original: kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sngon gyi smon lam las byung ba rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab snyam; kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs bsam gyis mi khyab snyam /

translated: Some thought, The purity that arises from the past aspirations of the blessed buddhas is inconceivable. Some thought, The lineage of the thus-gone ones of the blessed buddhas is inconceivable.

original: kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab snyam /

analyzed: kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs bsam gyis mi khyab snyam /

analyzed: kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab snyam mo //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis mkhyen pas byang chub sems @249b dpa' autpa la'i snying po la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi shugs su gyur
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis mkhyen pas byang chub sems @249b dpa' autpa la'i snying po la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi shugs su gyur
translated: Then the Bhagavat, knowing the thoughts of those bodhisattvas, blessed the bodhisattva Utpalagarbha with the blessing of the buddhas, and he became the power of the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snang bas snang bar gyur /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snang bas snang bar gyur /
translated: He became illuminated by the light of the tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis kun tu khyab par gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis kun tu khyab par gyur /
translated: He became pervaded by the splendor of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa la gnas par gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa la gnas par gyur /
translated: He became established in the fearlessness of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings su 'jug cing 'bab pa dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings su 'jug cing 'bab pa dang ldan par gyur /
translated: He became endowed with the entry into and descent of the dharmadhatu of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi che ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyis yul la zhugs par gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi che ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyis yul la zhugs par gyur /
translated: He became engaged in the field of the greatness and miracles of the buddhas.

original: chags pa med pa'i rnam par spyod pa med pa bcu rdul yab la gnas par gyur /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i rnam par spyod pa med pa bcu rdul yab la gnas par gyur /
translated: He was attended by ten who were free of attachment and free of activity.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdung gcig nas gcig tu 'ba' zhig shes par gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdung gcig nas gcig tu 'ba' zhig shes par gyur /

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul brjod du med pa la spyod cing bsgrub par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul brjod du med pa la spyod cing bsgrub par gyur to //
translated: He was engaged in and had accomplished the inexpressible way of the Dharma of the buddhas.

original: de nas autpa la'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pa rtogs shing shes nas /
analyzed: de nas autpa la'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pa rtogs shing shes nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Utpalagarbha, having realized and understood the entry into the realm of phenomena,

original: yid la chags pa med pa'i dbyings su bsgrubs te /
analyzed: yid la chags pa med pa'i dbyings su bsgrubs te /
translated: had accomplished the realm of the mind free of attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas chos thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang ldan par zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su rtogs shing sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / snying rje chen po'i go cha chen po bgos nas sems can thams cad la lta zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas chos thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang ldan par zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su rtogs shing sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / snying rje chen po'i go cha chen po bgos nas sems can thams cad la lta zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang /
translated: He had eliminated the obscurations to all phenomena through bodhisattva conduct, had entered into the possession of the aspiration of Samantabhadra, had realized all the buddhas and seen the buddhas, and had donned the great armor of great compassion. He was looking at all sentient beings and purifying them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i yi dam @250a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i yi dam @250a *//
translated: the mandala of the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct and vows,

analyzed: gyi dkyil 'khor brtsams pa dang / skad cig ma'i mthar song ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa dang / mi zad pa mthong ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa mngon du bya ba dang / gzungs thams cad snang bar gyur pa dang /
translated: the culmination of the instant, the accomplishment of the wisdom of the buddhas, the vision of the inexhaustible, the realization of omniscience, the illumination of all dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s,üîΩand the realization of the correct discriminations.

original: so sor yang dag par rig pa rtogs nas autpa la'i snying po byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi mthus padma'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: so sor yang dag par rig pa rtogs nas autpa la'i snying po byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi mthus padma'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Essence of the Lotus spoke to the bodhisattva Essence of the Lotus Flower:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod pa dpag tu med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod pa dpag tu med do //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par sprul pa chen po la gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par sprul pa chen po la gnas so //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i mtshan thams cad kyi mdzad pa brnyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i mtshan thams cad kyi mdzad pa brnyes so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas, endowed with the intention of samƒÅdhi, turn the wheel of the Dharma.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so sor yang dag par rig pa bzhi brjod du med par ston to //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi chos bsam du med pa la gnas so //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas abide in the inconceivable Dharma of all the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi sgra dbyangs dpag tu med par 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi sgra dbyangs dpag tu med par 'gro'o //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan @250b 'das rnams brjod du med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing chud do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan @250b 'das rnams brjod du med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing chud do //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas realize and enter the inexpressible realm of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi khyu mchog sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi khyu mchog sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas are the supreme leader of all the superknowledges.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious One!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi mtha' sgrib pa med pa la 'jug pa mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi mtha' sgrib pa med pa la 'jug pa mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, have entered into the unobstructed limit of the realm of phenomena.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO jinaputras!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bcu ste /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, have ten buddha qualities of the realm of phenomena that are without limit or center.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku mtha' dang / dbus med pa rnam par dag cing ma brnyogs pas thams cad du 'gro ba spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i spyan mtha' dang dbus med pas spyan mnyam pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku mtha' dang / dbus med pa rnam par dag cing ma brnyogs pas thams cad du 'gro ba spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i spyan mtha' dang dbus med pas spyan mnyam pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, have the pure and unobscured form body that is without limit or center, and they have abandoned going everywhere. The buddhas, the bhagavats, have the equality of the eye that is without limit or center and is unobstructed with regard to all phenomena. They have attained manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chags pa med pa'i snyan mtha' dang dbus med pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgra sgrib pa med par gsan pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis shangs kyi skye mched mtha' dang dbus med pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnga' mchog brnyes pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chags pa med pa'i snyan mtha' dang dbus med pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgra sgrib pa med par gsan pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis shangs kyi skye mched mtha' dang dbus med pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnga' mchog brnyes pa dang /
translated: The bhagavƒÅn buddhas hear all the sounds of all beings without obstruction because their ears, which are free from attachment, have no center or edge.üîΩThe bhagavƒÅn buddhas have attained the supreme power of all buddhas because their nose sense base has no center or edge.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags che zhing srab pa mtha' dang dbus med pas chos thams cad kyi dbyings su sgra dbyangs kyis 'gro ba @251a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags che zhing srab pa mtha' dang dbus med pas chos thams cad kyi dbyings su sgra dbyangs kyis 'gro ba @251a *//
translated: The bhagavƒÅn buddhas have tongues that are large and thin and have no center or edge, and they have the melodious sound of dharma in the realm of all phenomena.

original: dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku mtha' dang / dbus med pas las kyi lhag ma ma lus shing sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can gyi rgyud du de bzhin gshegs pa ston cing dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yid kyi las mtha' dang dbus med pas chos kyi dbyings kyi sku dbyer med cing dus gsum la ma chags pas rjes su 'gro ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku mtha' dang / dbus med pas las kyi lhag ma ma lus shing sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can gyi rgyud du de bzhin gshegs pa ston cing dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yid kyi las mtha' dang dbus med pas chos kyi dbyings kyi sku dbyer med cing dus gsum la ma chags pas rjes su 'gro ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: the bodies of the bhagavat buddhas are without end or middle, and the tathagatas are seen and perceived in the mindstreams of all beings in the realms of sentient beings without remainder;üîΩthe mental activity of the bhagavat buddhas is without end or middle, and the dharmadhatu body is indivisible and pure in following the three times without attachment;üîΩthe abodes of the buddhas, the bhagavats, are without end or middle, and the buddhas display and demonstrate the emanations and miracles of the buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa mtha' dang dbus med pas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul pa dang / cho 'phrul mi zad pa ston pa dang / snags rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa mtha' dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa mtha' dang dbus med pas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul pa dang / cho 'phrul mi zad pa ston pa dang / snags rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa mtha' dang /
translated: the bhagavat buddhas are without end or middle, and the buddhas demonstrate the pure realms of all worlds;

original: dbus med pas brjod du med pa'i rgyan byin gyis brlabs shing nyon mongs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: dbus med pas brjod du med pa'i rgyan byin gyis brlabs shing nyon mongs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: the display of the inconceivable, inexpressible, and limitless qualities of the buddhas; the display of the blessing of the inexpressible adornment of the middle way; the display of the buddha realm that is free of afflictions in accordance with one‚Äôs wishes;üîΩand the complete and perfect awakening to all phenomena through the complete perfection of the Dharma and the complete perfection of the wisdom display of the buddhas, the bhagavats, with regard to the specific conduct of all bodhisattvas,

original: smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ye shes kyis rnam par rol ba dang / chos kyi yongs su rdzogs shing ye shes kyis rnam par rol ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs pas chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ye shes kyis rnam par rol ba dang / chos kyi yongs su rdzogs shing ye shes kyis rnam par rol ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs pas chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: the complete perfection of their aspirations, the wisdom display, and the wisdom display of the complete perfection of the Dharma.

original: kye rgyal pa'i @251b sras; 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bcu'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal pa'i @251b sras; 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bcu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúO son of noble family, these are the ten qualities of the buddhas that are related to the middle way and are beyond center and edge.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of noble family,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa bcu ste /
translated: The buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, have ten attributes that reveal the nature of the accomplishment of the transcendent conquerors' gnosis.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho bar ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i tshe ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par byung bar ston pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'pho bar ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i tshe ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par byung bar ston pa dang /
translated: They are the following: to reveal the passing away from the Joyful Heaven in all world systems in a single instant; to reveal the life of a bodhisattva in all world systems in a single instant; to reveal the departure from home in all world systems in a single instant;

original: skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams cad du byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs shing mngon par byang chub par ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyis sems can rnams ji ltar smin zhing 'dul ba'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas mgu bar mdzad pa ston pa dang /üîΩskad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can rnams ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sna tshogs brjod du med pa'i dmigs pa ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du brjod @252a *//
analyzed: skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams cad du byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs shing mngon par byang chub par ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyis sems can rnams ji ltar smin zhing 'dul ba'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas mgu bar mdzad pa ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can rnams ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sna tshogs brjod du med pa'i dmigs pa ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du brjod @252a *//
translated: In an instant, they manifest seated at the foot of the tree of awakening in all world systems, demonstrating full awakening; in an instant, they demonstrate turning the wheel of Dharma in all world systems; in an instant, they demonstrate knowing the time to ripen and guide beings in all world systems, and thus delighting them;

original: du med pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan zhing /
analyzed: du med pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan zhing /
translated: in an instant, they demonstrate the various bodies of the thus-gone ones in all world systems, which are beyond expression and are in accord with the way beings are to be guided; in an instant, they demonstrate the various adornments of all world systems, which are beyond expression;

original: khyu mchog de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdzod ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thams cad rnam par dag pa ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'das pa dang /
analyzed: khyu mchog de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdzod ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thams cad rnam par dag pa ston pa dang / skad cig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'das pa dang /
translated: the supreme herd, the teaching of the treasury of omniscience of the tathagatas, the teaching of the complete purity of all worlds in an instant, the teaching of the appearance of the buddhas of the past, the future, and the present in all worlds in an instant,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa sna tshogs kyis spyod pa'i rim pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs mngon par mkhyen pa ston pa ste; kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa sna tshogs kyis spyod pa'i rim pa dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs mngon par mkhyen pa ston pa ste; kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: the teaching of the levels of conduct of various faculties, efforts, and faiths, and the teaching of the knowledge of the lineage of the buddhas of the three times.üîΩ‚ÄúO jinaputras!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa bcu'o //
translated: Those are the ten characteristics that the bhagavat buddhas teach as the accomplishment of the wisdom of buddhahood.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO jinaputras!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dus las mi 'da' ba bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dus las mi 'da' ba bcu ste /
translated: There are ten things that the bhagavat buddhas never transgress.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba las mi 'da' ba dang / dus de rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas yang dag par dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par smin pa las mi 'da' ba dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lung ston pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba las mi 'da' ba dang / dus de rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas yang dag par dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par smin pa las mi 'da' ba dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lung ston pa
translated: the buddhas, the bhagavats, do not pass beyond the time of the prophecy of the bodhisattvas who are completely ripened;üîΩthe buddhas, the bhagavats, do not pass beyond the time of displaying miracles according to the thoughts of sentient beings;

original: dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @252b dus mkhyen nas sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du cho 'phrul ston pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas sems can rnams ji ltar dad pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku'i byin gyi rlabs ston pa dang /
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @252b dus mkhyen nas sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du cho 'phrul ston pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas sems can rnams ji ltar dad pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku'i byin gyi rlabs ston pa dang /
translated: the buddhas, the bhagavats, do not pass beyond the time of displaying the blessing of the buddha body according to the faith of sentient beings;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas btang snyoms la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal du 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas ji ltar rab tu dang pa'i sems can rnams rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas btang snyoms la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal du 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas ji ltar rab tu dang pa'i sems can rnams rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: the blessed buddhas guide those beings who have faith, knowing the time;üîΩthe blessed buddhas guide those beings who are difficult to guide and who are afflicted, without being asked, knowing the time;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas nyon mongs shing gdul dka' ba'i sems can la mi btsams pas 'dul ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dmigs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas nyon mongs shing gdul dka' ba'i sems can la mi btsams pas 'dul ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus mkhyen nas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par sprul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dmigs pa ston pa ste /
translated: and the blessed buddhas display inconceivable emanations of buddhas, knowing the time.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus de nas dus las mi 'da' ba'o; ;kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus de nas dus las mi 'da' ba'o; ;kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: This is the buddhas, the blessed ones, not passing beyond the time.üîΩO son of the victors!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul mtshungs pa med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul mtshungs pa med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten objects of the bhagavat buddhas that are unequaled and inconceivable.

original: bcu gang zhe na /üîΩskyil mo krung gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad tshigs su bcad pa'i rtsa ba gcig yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / 'od zer gcig gis 'jig @253a *//
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / skyil mo krung gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad tshigs su bcad pa'i rtsa ba gcig yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / 'od zer gcig gis 'jig @253a *//
translated: What are the ten?

original: rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par snang ba dang / sku gcig gis sku thams cad du ston pa dang / phyogs gcig gis gnas dmigs pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sku dang / ye shes gcig gis chos thams cad bsgribs pa med par chud pa dang /
analyzed: rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par snang ba dang / sku gcig gis sku thams cad du ston pa dang / phyogs gcig gis gnas dmigs pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sku dang / ye shes gcig gis chos thams cad bsgribs pa med par chud pa dang /
translated: They are: sitting cross-legged and pervading all worlds without exception; teaching the root of a single verse to all buddhas; illuminating all worlds without exception with a single ray of light; displaying all bodies with a single body; the body that goes to all worlds without exception by observing a single direction; with a single wisdom, all phenomena are included without obstruction;

original: dus mkhyen nas sems gcig bskyed pas chos thams cad kyi dbyings kyis ma lus par khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi che ba tshad med pa'i rjes su song zhing gom pa gcig la de kho na nyid ston pa dang / dus gsum thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pas khyab pa dang /
analyzed: dus mkhyen nas sems gcig bskyed pas chos thams cad kyi dbyings kyis ma lus par khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi che ba tshad med pa'i rjes su song zhing gom pa gcig la de kho na nyid ston pa dang / dus gsum thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pas khyab pa dang /
translated: Knowing the time, they pervade all phenomena with a single mind and follow the immeasurable greatness of the buddhas. They teach suchness in a single step and pervade all three times with the perfect buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas 'gro ba thams cad dang mi 'dre zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'gro ba thams cad dang mi 'dre zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gcig ste /
translated: The buddhas are not separate from all beings, and the essence of the past, future, and present is one.

original: gnyis su med par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med par spyod pa'o //
translated: They engage in nonduality.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul mtshungs pa med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul mtshungs pa med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten domains of the blessed buddhas, which are unequaled and inconceivable.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa bcu ste /
translated: The tathƒÅgatas have ten knowledges that accomplish the blessings of the buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas par 'jug cing smon lam mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / lus med pa'i lus mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad gnyis su med pas @253b mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas par 'jug cing smon lam mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / lus med pa'i lus mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad gnyis su med pas @253b mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of how to accomplish aspirations without abiding in any phenomena, the knowledge of how to accomplish a body that is not a body, the knowledge of how to accomplish the complete and perfect awakening of all phenomena through nonduality,

original: sems can bdag med pa'i mthar gyur pa la sems can 'dul ba mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul thams cad ma lus pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sdud pa dang /
analyzed: sems can bdag med pa'i mthar gyur pa la sems can 'dul ba mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul thams cad ma lus pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sdud pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of how to accomplish the training of beings in the ultimate absence of self in beings, the knowledge of how to accomplish various signs in all signless phenomena, and the knowledge of how to include all the worlds and all the realms in the world systems.

original: 'gyur ba mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / yul thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed cing las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i dbyings su mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / yul thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed cing las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i dbyings su mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang /
translated: knowing how to accomplish the transformation of all phenomena, knowing how to accomplish the ripening of karma without engaging with any object, knowing how to accomplish all phenomena within the realm of the inexpressible,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang ma yin /
translated: knowing how to accomplish the non-afflicted and the non-purified,

original: rnam par byang ba'ang ma yin par mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med pa la skye zhing 'god pa'i mtshan nyid rkyen dang / 'du ba tshogs te byung ba mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang ma yin par mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med pa la skye zhing 'god pa'i mtshan nyid rkyen dang / 'du ba tshogs te byung ba mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa ste /
translated: and knowing how to accomplish the arising and the characteristics of the arising of all phenomena that are unborn, which are conditioned by the gathering of conditions.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs mngon par sgrub pa mkhyen pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten knowledges of the thus-gone ones that accomplish the blessings of the buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa tshad med pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa tshad med pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten immeasurable qualities that belong to the blessed buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: dus gsum thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i cho 'phrul gsum sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @254a *//
analyzed: dus gsum thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i cho 'phrul gsum sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @254a *//
translated: the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are included in all the three times;üîΩthe three miracles of taming all sentient beings, which are included in the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones;üîΩthe Buddhadharmas, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s, and the skill in the analysis of the roots of verses, which are included in the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones;

original: su gtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / gzungs dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i rtsa ba rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang //
analyzed: su gtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / gzungs dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i rtsa ba rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang //
translated: all the wheels of Dharma and the four specific knowledges of the TathƒÅgatas, which are included in the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones;

original: snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la rnam par gzigs shing rtag tu mnyam pas phan par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la rnam par gzigs shing rtag tu mnyam pas phan par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang /
translated: They are included among the blessed buddhas because they never abandon any being through great compassion. They are included among the blessed buddhas because they always watch over all beings and always benefit them impartially.

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas sems can thams cad 'dul ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings la mi chags par gnas pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / skad cig la 'das pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas sems can thams cad 'dul ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings la mi chags par gnas pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / skad cig la 'das pa dang /
translated: They are included among the blessed buddhas because they guide all beings through their roots of virtue. They are included among the blessed buddhas because they abide without attachment to the realm of all phenomena. They are included among the blessed buddhas because they are beyond the past, future, and present.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / nyi ma gcig la dus gsum gyi bskal pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro zhing ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa dang / nyi ma gcig la dus gsum gyi bskal pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro zhing ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su gtogs pa ste /
translated: all the buddhas of the past, present, and future who are included among the bhagavat buddhas, and all the kalpas of the three times in a single day, which are included among the bhagavat buddhas who are teachers.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @254b su gtogs pa tshad med pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @254b su gtogs pa tshad med pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten immeasurable categories that are included among the bhagavat buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre bcu ste /
translated: There are ten extremely difficult to fathom Dharma canopies of the bhagavat buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: bdud kyi rgol ba bcom zhing gtor ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang / gzhan mur 'dug dang / pha rol rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi rgol ba bcom zhing gtor ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang / gzhan mur 'dug dang / pha rol rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang /
translated: the great canopy of the Dharma, which is extremely difficult to bear, of the blessed buddhas, who have conquered and destroyed the attacks of MƒÅra; the great canopy of the Dharma, which is extremely difficult to bear, of the blessed buddhas, who have defeated all opponents and those who are arrogant;

original: sems can thams cad 'dul zhing tshim par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang / sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'dul zhing tshim par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang / sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang /
translated: the great canopy of the Dharma, which is extremely difficult to bear, of the blessed buddhas, who have satisfied and trained all beings; and the great canopy of the Dharma, which is extremely difficult to bear, of the blessed buddhas, who have gone to all the worlds in order to train beings.

original: gnas dang / so so yang dag par rig pa ston pa dang / sems can gti mug med cing dang ba'i sems can thos pas 'dul ba shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams pa spu'i bu ga gcig bzhin du ba spu'i khams thams cad nas rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa de snyed gshegs pa gnas pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: gnas dang / so so yang dag par rig pa ston pa dang / sems can gti mug med cing dang ba'i sems can thos pas 'dul ba shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams pa spu'i bu ga gcig bzhin du ba spu'i khams thams cad nas rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa de snyed gshegs pa gnas pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba dang /
translated: the place, the teaching of the analytical knowledges, the great canopy of the Dharma that is very difficult to bear, which is the teaching for sentient beings who are free from delusion and who are disciplined by hearing, and the arising of the buddhas, the bhagavats, in the manner of abiding, in numbers equal to the particles of dust in every pore of the body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ba spu'i bu gnas 'di bzhin du rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sems can 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ba spu'i bu gnas 'di bzhin du rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sems can 'byin pa ste /
translated: In this way, from the pores of the Buddha's body, sentient beings emerge in numbers equal to the particles of dust in all world systems.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po'o //
translated: This is the great canopy of the Dharma that is very difficult to bear for the buddhas, the bhagavats.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gnas gcig gi rab tu phra ba'i rdul la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyan rang bzhin gyis 'tsher bas chos kyi 'khor lo skor zhing sems can 'dul ba rgyun mi gcod la gtong ba med kyang gnod pa med cing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'ang gnod pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gnas gcig gi rab tu phra ba'i rdul la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyan rang bzhin gyis 'tsher bas chos kyi 'khor lo skor zhing sems can 'dul ba rgyun mi gcod la gtong ba med kyang gnod pa med cing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'ang gnod pa med de /
translated: They display the wheel of the Dharma, which is the natural radiance of the adornments of the buddhas, and they do so without interruption, without relinquishing, without harm, and without any world realms being harmed.

original: rab tu phra ba'i rdul de rgyas par byas pa'ang med /
analyzed: rab tu phra ba'i rdul de rgyas par byas pa'ang med /
translated: They do not expand that atom.üîΩThey do not make the world realms smaller.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams chung ngur byas pa'ang med pa @255b chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs shing mkhyen nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams chung ngur byas pa'ang med pa @255b chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs shing mkhyen nas gnas pa ste /
translated: They know and understand the realm of phenomena and abide in it.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po'o //
translated: This is the great canopy of the Dharma that is very difficult for the lord buddhas to bear.

original: mun pa med pa'i dbyings su de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te mun pa dang bcas pa snang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: mun pa med pa'i dbyings su de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te mun pa dang bcas pa snang bar gyur nas /
translated: In the realm free of darkness, the Thus-Gone One fully awakened and, with darkness gone, became illuminated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rab rib med pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rab rib med pa /
translated: The qualities of buddhahood are free of cataracts.

original: rnam par rab rib med pa'i gnas la sems can pha rol 'dzud pa dang / de na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i rjes su song ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rab rib med pa'i gnas la sems can pha rol 'dzud pa dang / de na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i rjes su song ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One has entered the state free of cataracts, and he leads other beings there.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu bzod par dka' ba'i chos kyi bla bre chen po bcu'o //
translated: This is the tenth great Dharma canopy, extremely difficult to bear, of the blessed buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of noble family!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zil gyis gnon pa'i chos kyi bla bre chen po bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zil gyis gnon pa'i chos kyi bla bre chen po bcu'o //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of noble family!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten qualities of the blessed buddhas that are completely pure and beyond reproach.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba shin tu bsgrubs te /
translated: The greatness of the bhagavƒÅn buddhas is extremely accomplished.üîΩEverywhere they are without misdeeds and completely pure.

translated: The family of the bhagavƒÅn buddhas is exalted from the past. The family of all the bhagavƒÅn buddhas of the past, present, and future is without misdeeds and completely pure.üîΩThe family of the tathƒÅgatas is pure.üîΩThe bhagavƒÅn buddhas do not abide in consciousness. The greatness of all the bhagavƒÅn buddhas of the future is without misdeeds and completely pure.

original: rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa la mi gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha' ma'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos thams cad la gnas pa bcom zhing dus gsum la mi gnas par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa la mi gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha' ma'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos thams cad la gnas pa bcom zhing dus gsum la mi gnas par spyod pa ste /
translated: The bhagavƒÅn buddhas have destroyed the abodes of all phenomena and act without abiding in the three times.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the greatness of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, which is everywhere irreproachable and completely pure.

original: sna tshogs kyi blang ba med pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyan gcig pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi blang ba med pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyan gcig pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are the essence of the single ornament, because they are free from the acceptance of variety.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the greatness of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, which is everywhere irreproachable and completely pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams zad mi shes pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mnyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i bsod nams zad mi shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams zad mi shes pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mnyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i bsod nams zad mi shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are endowed with inexhaustible merit, with merit that is equal to the limit of the end and the beginning, and that abides in the realm of phenomena, which is inexhaustible.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //

original: sems can 'dul ba'i don gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzugs dang / kha dog mtha' med par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na chags pa med par bzhugs te /

translated: For the sake of disciplining sentient beings, the Lord Buddhas abide in all world-realms without attachment, with infinite forms and colors.

translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: dus thams cad du 'jig rten gyi yul khams thams cad na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa bcu ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'jig rten gyi yul khams thams cad na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa bcu ste /
translated: At all times, in all the world systems, the Bhagavat Buddhas perform ten deeds.

original: bcu gang zhe na /üîΩsangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rab tu rnyed pa'i sems can rnams la dus thams cad du sangs rgyas ston pa dang / dus thams cad du sems can shes kyi sems can la chos ston pa dang / dus thams cad du sangs rgyas la sems rab tu dang ba'i sems can la tshad med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rab tu rnyed pa'i sems can rnams la dus thams cad du sangs rgyas ston pa dang / dus thams cad du sems can shes kyi sems can la chos ston pa dang / dus thams cad du sangs rgyas la sems rab tu dang ba'i sems can la tshad med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang /
translated: What are the ten?üîΩThey are:üîΩto always reveal the Buddha to beings who have attained the recollection of the Buddha; to always teach the Dharma to beings who have the thought of enlightenment; to always cause beings who have faith in the Buddha to generate the roots of virtue that are immeasurable;

original: dus thams cad du chos mi 'gyur ba'i lam du 'das pa'i sems can la ye shes rtogs par mdzad pa dang / dus thams cad du 'gro ba thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod pa dang / dus thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa mi chags par bzhud pa dang /
analyzed: dus thams cad du chos mi 'gyur ba'i lam du 'das pa'i sems can la ye shes rtogs par mdzad pa dang / dus thams cad du 'gro ba thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod pa dang / dus thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa mi chags par bzhud pa dang /
translated: to always cause beings who have gone on the path of the unchanging Dharma to realize gnosis; to always perform the deeds of the Buddha without interruption for all beings; to always go to all the world systems without attachment;

original: dus thams cad du sems can thams @258a *//
analyzed: dus thams cad du sems can thams @258a *//

translated: the emanations of the blessed buddhas as various buddhas at all times,
