translated: These are the ten inexhaustible great treasuries of wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO jinaputras!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan bcu ste /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, have ten eyes.

original: bcu gang zhe na /üîΩgang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin cing mngon par byung ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad mi mkhyen pa mi mnga' ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad la thugs rje che ba'i spyan dang /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin cing mngon par byung ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad mi mkhyen pa mi mnga' ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad la thugs rje che ba'i spyan dang /
translated: What are these ten?üîΩThe eye that sees all the perfections and the manifest realizations of all the buddhas, the bhagavats; the eye that knows all phenomena without exception of all the buddhas, the bhagavats; the eye of great compassion for all beings of all the buddhas, the bhagavats;

original: gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan @259a *//
analyzed: gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan @259a *//
translated: the eye that sees the entire realm of phenomena of all the buddhas, the bhagavats;

original: 'das rnams tshad med pa'i stobs bcu thams cad dang ldan pa'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can thams cad 'dul bar zhugs pa'i spyan dang /
analyzed: 'das rnams tshad med pa'i stobs bcu thams cad dang ldan pa'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can thams cad 'dul bar zhugs pa'i spyan dang /
translated: the eye of the buddhas, the bhagavats, that has the power of the ten powers; the eye of the buddhas, the bhagavats, that turns the wheel of the unsurpassed Dharma; the eye of the buddhas, the bhagavats, that engages in taming all beings;

original: gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba thams cad mngon du rdzogs par sangs rgyas par mdzad pa'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pas 'dul ba'i sems can la 'dul ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gnyis su med par spyod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la dbang ba'i spyan dang /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba thams cad mngon du rdzogs par sangs rgyas par mdzad pa'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pas 'dul ba'i sems can la 'dul ba'i spyan dang / gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gnyis su med par spyod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la dbang ba'i spyan dang /
translated: the eye of the buddhas, the bhagavats, that causes the complete buddhahood of all beings to be directly perceived; the eye of the buddhas, the bhagavats, that tames beings through remaining; the eye of the buddhas, the bhagavats, that has power over the characteristics of the Dharma of nondual conduct;

original: gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ji ltar sems can btul te smin par mdzad nas /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ji ltar sems can btul te smin par mdzad nas /
translated: It is thus that the Lord Buddhas, having trained and matured sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha'i phyir sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha'i phyir sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ston pa ste /
translated: demonstrate the transcendence of suffering in the buddha-fields at the limits of space.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Conqueror!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyan bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten eyes of the Lord Buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Conqueror!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' yas par ston pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' yas par ston pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten teachings of the Lord Buddhas that reveal the infinity of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams la mtha' @259b yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi spyod pa sna tshogs mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams la mtha' @259b yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi spyod pa sna tshogs mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang /
translated: the gateway of the Bhagavat Buddha that teaches the infinite realms of sentient beings,üîΩthe gateway of the Bhagavat Buddha that teaches the infinite various conduct of sentient beings, the gateway of the Bhagavat Buddha that teaches the infinite ripening of the karma of all sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad la gdams pa rjes su bstan pa mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams rnam par spyod pa'i nan tan mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gdams pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa la 'god pa'i sgo dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad la gdams pa rjes su bstan pa mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams rnam par spyod pa'i nan tan mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gdams pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa la 'god pa'i sgo dang /
translated: the gateway of the Bhagavat Buddha that teaches the infinite instructions and follow-up teachings for all sentient beings, the gateway of the Bhagavat Buddha that teaches the infinite practice of the realms of sentient beings, and the gateway of the Bhagavat Buddha that establishes the infinite teachings on the conduct of bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i rim pa'i khyad par bzhin smon lam gyis 'byung ba mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad la sdud pa dang / 'gyur ba mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i rim pa'i khyad par bzhin smon lam gyis 'byung ba mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad la sdud pa dang / 'gyur ba mtha' yas par ston pa'i sgo dang /
translated: the gateway of the buddhas, the bhagavats, to reveal the infinite arising of the bodhisattvas through their aspirations; the gateway of the buddhas, the bhagavats, to reveal the infinite transformations of all the realms of beings without exception;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa dang / dad pa bzhin ston pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /üîΩda ltar byung ba de dang de dag tu sangs rgyas thams cad gcig nas gcig tu bskal @260a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa dang / dad pa bzhin ston pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dang de dag tu sangs rgyas thams cad gcig nas gcig tu bskal @260a *//
translated: the gateway of the buddhas, the bhagavats, to reveal to the bodhisattvas the pure buddha realms according to their aspirations and faith; and the gateway of the buddhas, the bhagavats, to reveal the succession of all the buddhas in the past, present, and future in all the worlds without exception.

original: par 'byung ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthus bsdus nas yongs su snang zhing /
analyzed: par 'byung ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthus bsdus nas yongs su snang zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúThe buddhas, the bhagavats, through their power gather together and reveal the succession of the buddhas, the bhagavats, who appear in the past, present, and future in the world realms of the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes rnam par rig pa mtha' yas pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes rnam par rig pa mtha' yas pa'i sgo ste /
translated: It is the gateway to the infinite awareness of all buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos mtha' yas par ston pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos mtha' yas par ston pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten ways in which the transcendent conquerors teach the infinite Dharma.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu ste /
translated: The transcendent conquerors' deeds of a buddha are tenfold.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku bstan pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung gis kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku bstan pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung gis kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: The transcendent conquerors' deeds of a buddha are to engage in the deeds of a buddha for sentient beings by displaying the transcendent conquerors' form bodies, by the transcendent conquerors' speech,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzung bas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mi 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzung bas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mi 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, perform buddha activities for sentient beings by means of their retention.üîΩThe buddhas, the bhagavats, perform buddha activities for sentient beings by means of their nonretention.üîΩThe buddhas, the bhagavats, perform buddha activities for sentient beings by means of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: chu dang / me dang / rlung gis kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi yul gyi dbang gis brtsam pa'i yul thams cad kyis kyang sems @260b can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung gis kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi yul gyi dbang gis brtsam pa'i yul thams cad kyis kyang sems @260b can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, perform buddha activities for sentient beings by means of all objects that are created by the power of the domain of the buddhas‚Äô blessings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan gyis kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhing rtsom pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan gyis kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhing rtsom pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: They perform buddha activity for sentient beings through the names of the blessed buddhas. They perform buddha activity for sentient beings through the composition of the blessed buddhas‚Äô buddha realms. They perform buddha activity for sentient beings through the blessed buddhas‚Äô pure buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bas kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa ste /
translated: They perform buddha activity for sentient beings through the blessed buddhas‚Äô silence.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten ways in which the blessed buddhas perform buddha activity for sentient beings.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bcu ste /
translated: There are ten topics of sentient beings that are the essence of the Dharma of the blessed buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: smon lam rgyun mi gcod cing smon lam brtan pa dang / gnyis su med par bshad pa ji ltar smras pa de bzhin byed pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam rgyun mi gcod cing smon lam brtan pa dang / gnyis su med par bshad pa ji ltar smras pa de bzhin byed pa ste /
translated: They are: not interrupting one‚Äôs prayers, but making them firm; not being dualistic, but explaining things as they are, and acting accordingly.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po dang po'o //
translated: This is the first essential of the Dharma for sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu brtson zhing ma zhum par phyi ma'i mtha' bskal par 'gro zhing yon tan gyi rgyan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu brtson zhing ma zhum par phyi ma'i mtha' bskal par 'gro zhing yon tan gyi rgyan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: They are: not being discouraged, but striving in the bodhisattva deeds, going to the far shore of the future, and perfecting all the ornaments of good qualities.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po gnyis so //üîΩbrjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dul @261a *//
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po gnyis so // brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dul @261a *//
translated: This is the second essential of the Dharma for sentient beings.

original: bar 'os pa'i sems can gcig gzigs na'ang mi bzhugs par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gshegs te /
analyzed: bar 'os pa'i sems can gcig gzigs na'ang mi bzhugs par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gshegs te /
translated: They are: not remaining in a world-realm, but going to all world-realms, when they see a single sentient being who is to be guided in an inexpressible, times-inexpressible number of world-realms.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po gsum mo //
translated: This is the third essential of the Dharma for sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi sems mi 'phrog pa la thugs rje chen po mnyam pa dang / sems can sems rab tu dang ba la thugs rje chen po mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi sems mi 'phrog pa la thugs rje chen po mnyam pa dang / sems can sems rab tu dang ba la thugs rje chen po mnyam pa ste /
translated: The great compassion of the Buddhas is equal with regard to the minds of sentient beings which are not distracted, and with regard to the minds of sentient beings which are clear.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four essences of the Dharma of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba'ang ma yin /
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones do not appear,

original: ma byung ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ma byung ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor do they not appear.

original: gang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du byang chub kyi sems mi 'jig ste /
analyzed: gang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du byang chub kyi sems mi 'jig ste /
translated: From the time when they first give rise to the mind of enlightenment until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the mind of enlightenment does not perish.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyis snying po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyis snying po lnga'o //
translated: These are the five essences of the Dharma of sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo bar 'jug cing 'jig rten gyi phyir mi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo bar 'jug cing 'jig rten gyi phyir mi spyod pa ste /
translated: Having gathered all the roots of virtue, they engage in the dedication to omniscience and do not engage in conduct for the sake of the world.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po drug go /
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po drug go /
translated: These are the six essential points of the Dharma for sentient beings.

original: thog mar sems kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rjes su lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las la slob ste /
analyzed: thog mar sems kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rjes su lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las la slob ste /
translated: First, with the mind, one trains in the physical, verbal, and mental actions that follow the conduct of all the buddhas.

original: thams cad mkhyen par bsngo zhing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod par ma yin pas bla na med pa @261b yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par bsngo zhing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod par ma yin pas bla na med pa @261b yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: Since one dedicates everything to omniscience and not to the conduct of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, one fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bdun no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bdun no //
translated: These are the seven essential points of the Dharma for sentient beings.

original: mtha' yas par 'od thams cad kun tu snang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad snang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems rnam par dag pa 'di snang ba thams cad mtshungs pa thams cad mtshungs par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas par 'od thams cad kun tu snang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad snang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems rnam par dag pa 'di snang ba thams cad mtshungs pa thams cad mtshungs par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The light of the infinite is the light of all appearances, the light of all the buddhadharmas, and the light of the bodhisattva‚Äôs pure mind.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight essential natures of the Dharma of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad spong ba dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba la mi 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i smon lam thams cad mtshungs par 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad dang ldan pas sdug bsngal thams cad 'jig cing spros pa thams cad med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad spong ba dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba la mi 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i smon lam thams cad mtshungs par 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad dang ldan pas sdug bsngal thams cad 'jig cing spros pa thams cad med pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú ‚ÄòAbandoning all worldly happiness, not desiring worldly joy, and being unstained by any worldly thing, they make the aspiration to be endowed with all worldly happiness, to destroy all suffering, and to be free from all conceptual elaboration.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po dgu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine essential natures of the Dharma of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul la dad pas dka' ba dang / dka' thub kyi sems bskyed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul la dad pas dka' ba dang / dka' thub kyi sems bskyed do //
translated: ‚Äú ‚ÄòWith faith in the domain of the buddhas, they generate the intention to endure hardship and hardship.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs bsrung ba la brtson pas 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam par sdug bsngal thams cad rig pas rig cing stobs dang / sa bcu'i bar gyi mthar byung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs bsrung ba la brtson pas 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam par sdug bsngal thams cad rig pas rig cing stobs dang / sa bcu'i bar gyi mthar byung ba ste /
translated: They protect the lineage of all the buddhas, and through being equal to all beings, they know all suffering. They have the power to reach the end of the ten levels.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bcu pa'o //
translated: This is the tenth essential nature of the Dharma of sentient beings.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚Äú ‚ÄòO son of the victors!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bcu'o //üîΩkye rgyal @262a *//
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi chos kyi snying po bcu'o // kye rgyal @262a *//
translated: These are the ten dharmic essences of the buddhas.

original: ba'i sras / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi chags par spyod pa bcu ste /
analyzed: ba'i sras / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi chags par spyod pa bcu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors, there are ten kinds of unattached conduct of the buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gshegs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na bzhugs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na 'chag bzhengs bzhugs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gshegs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na bzhugs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na 'chag bzhengs bzhugs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the blessed ones, go to all the worlds without attachment. The buddhas, the blessed ones, remain in all the worlds without attachment. The buddhas, the blessed ones, walk, stand, and sit in all the worlds without attachment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na chos ston pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad dang / dga' ldan gnas su gshegs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na chos ston pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad dang / dga' ldan gnas su gshegs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, teach the Dharma in all worlds without attachment.üîΩThe buddhas, the bhagavats, go to the Tu·π£ita realm in all worlds without attachment.üîΩThe buddhas, the bhagavats, go to the past, future, and present without attachment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung bar yang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du tshad med pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gshegs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung bar yang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du tshad med pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gshegs pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, go to immeasurable retinue ma·πá·∏çalas in all worlds without attachment.

original: sems can ma lus @262b pa thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la rnam par gzigs shing sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la cho 'phrul gsum ston cing sems can 'dul ba'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gcig gis tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab par gshegs shing sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa chen po spyod pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can ma lus @262b pa thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la rnam par gzigs shing sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la cho 'phrul gsum ston cing sems can 'dul ba'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gcig gis tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab par gshegs shing sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa chen po spyod pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa dang /
translated: They observe the mental behavior of all sentient beings without exception and, in a single instant of mind, they display the three kinds of spiritual miracles and guide sentient beings without engaging in conduct.üîΩThey manifest in the form of a single blessed buddha and, without engaging in conduct, they proceed to inconceivable, immeasurable buddhafields and engage in the great conduct of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab par gshegs shing sems can tshad med pa bcu rdul yab ma lus pa thams cad la ston pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi mtha' yas bsdus pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab par gshegs shing sems can tshad med pa bcu rdul yab ma lus pa thams cad la ston pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi mtha' yas bsdus pa'ang mi chags par spyod pa ste /
translated: They manifest to all the inconceivable, immeasurable blessed buddhas and to all the countless sentient beings without exception and, without engaging in conduct, they proceed to the infinite buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mi chags par spyod pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mi chags par spyod pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten ways in which the Lord Buddha is not attached.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi sku'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi sku'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa bcu ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have ten supreme and sublime ornaments of the Buddha‚Äôs body, which are unsurpassed.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku'i mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa sangs rgyas kyi sku'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku'i mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa sangs rgyas kyi sku'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: The Lord Buddhas‚Äô bodies are adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the supreme and sublime ornament of the Buddha‚Äôs body, which is unsurpassed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yan lag drug cu mchog dam pa dang ldan zhing gsung gi yan lag brgya rtsa lnga yongs su bzung ba brgya stong du mas brgyan pa mtha' dang / mu med pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam @263a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yan lag drug cu mchog dam pa dang ldan zhing gsung gi yan lag brgya rtsa lnga yongs su bzung ba brgya stong du mas brgyan pa mtha' dang / mu med pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam @263a *//
translated: The Lord Buddhas have the supreme and sublime sixty branches, and their speech is adorned with the one hundred and fifty branches of speech, which is the supreme and sublime ornament of the Buddha‚Äôs speech, which is unsurpassed.üîΩThe Lord Buddhas have an infinite and limitless voice, which is the supreme and sublime ornament of the Buddha‚Äôs voice, which is unsurpassed.

original: par dag pa brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / don tshig 'bru rab tu dang ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa chen pos mi 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med par seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pas chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sems can thams cad la thos pa dang /
analyzed: par dag pa brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / don tshig 'bru rab tu dang ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa chen pos mi 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med par seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pas chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sems can thams cad la thos pa dang /
translated: With great fearlessness, they roar the lion‚Äôs roar without fear or hesitation, and thus they cause the entire realm of phenomena to be heard by all sentient beings.

original: snang ba dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs dang / dbang po sna tshogs kyi rim pa so sor slong zhing 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs dang / dbang po sna tshogs kyi rim pa so sor slong zhing 'dul ba ste /
translated: They cause them to see and understand, and they gradually guide and tame the various thoughts and faculties of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, highest, and most sacred ornament of the speech of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yid kyi las stobs bcus brgyan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yid kyi las stobs bcus brgyan pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mental activity of the blessed buddhas is adorned with the ten powers.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ting nge 'dzin chen pos rgyas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan te chags pa med pa'i yul gyi spyod yul ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ting nge 'dzin chen pos rgyas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan te chags pa med pa'i yul gyi spyod yul ba /
translated: All the buddhas are replete with great samƒÅdhi and are adorned with the ornaments of the eighteen unique qualities of the buddhas. They are the ones who have the domain of nonattachment.

original: chos kyi dbyings la rab tu gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi yan lag brnyes te chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi dus gsum ma lus pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la rab tu gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi yan lag brnyes te chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi dus gsum ma lus pa dang /
translated: They abide in the realm of phenomena and have attained the branches of all the qualities of the buddhas. They are the ones who are the ornaments of the entire realm of phenomena and who, in a single instant of mind, have the wisdom that knows the three times in their entirety.

original: chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa ste /
translated: They are the ones who know the realm of all phenomena and the mental activity of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyi rgyan @263b dam pa mchog bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyi rgyan @263b dam pa mchog bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, highest, and unsurpassed mental ornament of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis brjod du med pa'i 'od bye ba khrag khrig rab tu btang nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis brjod du med pa'i 'od bye ba khrag khrig rab tu btang nas /
translated: The blessed buddhas emit trillions of inexpressible lights.

original: 'od zer brjod du med pa gcig nas gcig tu 'od zer gyi dra bar bskor cing zhing med bcu rdul yab ma lus pa thams cad du snang bar byas pa /üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi mun pa'i rigs ston pa /
analyzed: 'od zer brjod du med pa gcig nas gcig tu 'od zer gyi dra bar bskor cing zhing med bcu rdul yab ma lus pa thams cad du snang bar byas pa / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi mun pa'i rigs ston pa /
translated: One of these lights is transformed into an infinite number of lights, which form a net of light rays that illuminate all the worlds in the ten directions.üîΩIt dispels all the different kinds of darkness in all the world systems.

original: 'dzums pa ston pa'i zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs du ma kha dog brgya stong bye ba khrag khrig tshad med grangs med pa byung bas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can gyi
analyzed: 'dzums pa ston pa'i zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs du ma kha dog brgya stong bye ba khrag khrig tshad med grangs med pa byung bas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can gyi
translated: From his face, which is the door of his smile, he emits immeasurable light rays of many different colors, of a hundred thousand quintillion colors, which illuminate the entire realm of sentient beings in the immeasurable, countless worlds in the ten directions.

original: khams la snang bas shes par byed cing /
analyzed: khams la snang bas shes par byed cing /
translated: They make them known.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral zhing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gdon mi za ba phyir mi ldog pa brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung zhing bzhugs pa'i sku rnam par dag pas dga' ba med par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral zhing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gdon mi za ba phyir mi ldog pa brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung zhing bzhugs pa'i sku rnam par dag pas dga' ba med par 'byung ba ste /
translated: They are the cause for the attainment of the state of unsurpassable perfect enlightenment, for never being separated from the appearance of the buddhas and for the certainty of performing the deeds of the buddhas, without ever turning back.üîΩ

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: They are the unsurpassed, supreme, pure ornament of light of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gzhan du lung ston pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgrib pa med par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gzhan du lung ston pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgrib pa med par mdzad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe blessed buddhas do not teach the Dharma in other places, but they make the Dharma heard in all worlds.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rab rib med pas 'jig rten thams cad du 'dzum pa mdzad pa ston pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rab rib med pas 'jig rten thams cad du 'dzum pa mdzad pa ston pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the unsurpassed, supreme, pure ornament of the blessed buddhas‚Äô smile that is shown to the entire world without any obscuration.

original: tshad @264a *// med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku sgrib pa med cing rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: tshad @264a *// med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku sgrib pa med cing rnam par dag pa /
translated: The Dharma body of the buddhas, the blessed ones, is unobscured and pure.

original: chos thams cad la ma chags pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la ma chags pa /
translated: It is unattached to any phenomenon.

original: mtha' med pa'i chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus med par chud pa /
analyzed: mtha' med pa'i chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus med par chud pa /
translated: It is immersed in the realm of phenomena, which is limitless and without end or middle.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: It is not mixed with any world.

original: 'jig rten thams cad de kho na nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad de kho na nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: It follows the suchness of all worlds.

original: 'jig rten thams cad 'jig rten las 'das par spyod par 'jug pa'i tshig gi lam chad cing brjod du med par chud pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad 'jig rten las 'das par spyod par 'jug pa'i tshig gi lam chad cing brjod du med par chud pa /
translated: It is immersed in the path of words that is severed and inexpressible, which is the entry into the transcendent conduct of all worlds.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from the aggregates, elements, and sense sources.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, highest, and most excellent Dharma ornament of the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od tshad med pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od tshad med pa /
translated: The light of the buddhas, the blessed ones, is immeasurable.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad dbyer med pa'i 'od /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad dbyer med pa'i 'od /
translated: It is the light that pervades all worlds without exception.

original: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rgyan kha dog sna tshogs du ma'i rkyen kun nas mi phrog pa'i 'od /üîΩ'jig rten thams cad la ma chags pa'i 'od /üîΩtshad med pa sgrib pa med pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mdzod thams cad khang pa ltar gyur pa ste /üîΩ'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan bla na med pa mchog dam pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rgyan kha dog sna tshogs du ma'i rkyen kun nas mi phrog pa'i 'od / 'jig rten thams cad la ma chags pa'i 'od / tshad med pa sgrib pa med pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mdzod thams cad khang pa ltar gyur pa ste / 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan bla na med pa mchog dam pa'o //
translated: The adornment of the light of the Buddhas is the light of the inconceivable, the light of the inconceivable adornment, the light of the various colors, the light of the various conditions, the light of the various conditions that cannot be taken away,üîΩthe light of non-attachment to the entire world,üîΩthe light of the treasury of the sphere of the unobstructed light of the immeasurable.üîΩThis is the supreme, highest, most excellent, unsurpassed adornment of the light of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.üîΩ

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi kha dog mtha' yas pa /üîΩkha dog 'tsher ba /üîΩkha dog rang bzhin gyis 'tsher ba /üîΩkha dog tshad med pa /üîΩsems can ma lus pa thams @264b cad kyi bsam pa dang / dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig par byed pa'i kha dog ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi kha dog mtha' yas pa /üîΩkha dog 'tsher ba /üîΩkha dog rang bzhin gyis 'tsher ba /üîΩkha dog tshad med pa /üîΩsems can ma lus pa thams @264b cad kyi bsam pa dang / dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig par byed pa'i kha dog ste /
translated: The adornment of the light of the buddhas is the light of the inconceivable, the light of the inconceivable of the inconceivable, the light of the inconceivable of the inconceivable of the
