original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mi zlog pa'i kha dog dang / kha dog thams cad kyi mchog brnyes pas de las gzhan pa'i kha dog dang / khams gsum gyi kha dog thams cad khyab pa zil gyis mnan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mi zlog pa'i kha dog dang / kha dog thams cad kyi mchog brnyes pas de las gzhan pa'i kha dog dang / khams gsum gyi kha dog thams cad khyab pa zil gyis mnan pa ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddha has the color of the non-regressing color, and has attained the supreme color of all colors, which surpasses all other colors and the colors of the three realms.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi kha dog gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi kha dog gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, highest, and most excellent ornament of color of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge ba shin tu rnam par dag pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs dge ba rin po che 'byung ba 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma smad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge ba shin tu rnam par dag pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs dge ba rin po che 'byung ba 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma smad pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha has the pure, good qualities of the past, future, and present, and the good qualities of the Buddha family, which are the source of precious things, and are not reproached by anyone in the world.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pas chos thams cad kyi de kho na mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam par spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyan dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sgribs pa med cing rigs rnam par dag pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes las byung zhing 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pas chos thams cad kyi de kho na mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam par spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyan dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sgribs pa med cing rigs rnam par dag pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes las byung zhing 'dus pa ste /
translated: the ornament of the accumulation of the wisdom of omniscience, which is the stainless and pure lineage of the TathƒÅgatas;

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rigs dang / gdung rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rigs dang / gdung rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: this is the supreme, highest, pure ornament of the lineage and family of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku byams pa chen po'i stobs kyis brgyan pa shin tu dang zhing rnyog pa med pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i sku'i 'du byed nyam rangs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku byams pa chen po'i stobs kyis brgyan pa shin tu dang zhing rnyog pa med pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i sku'i 'du byed nyam rangs pa /
translated: The body of the Blessed Buddhas is adorned with the power of great love, with the body of conception that is very clear and free from turbidity, with the body of volitions that are not lax,

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba blta bas mi ngoms pas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba blta bas mi ngoms pas /
translated: with the body that is very distinct and never satiates the eyes,

original: thugs rje chen po'i thugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi sbyin gnas dang / @265a *//
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i thugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi sbyin gnas dang / @265a *//
translated: with the mind of great compassion, the field of generosity for all beings,

original: skyabs med kyi mchog bla na med pa so sor 'dzin pa rnams la thugs brtse zhing phan par bzhed pa /
analyzed: skyabs med kyi mchog bla na med pa so sor 'dzin pa rnams la thugs brtse zhing phan par bzhed pa /
translated: He is the supreme, unsurpassed refuge for those who have no refuge.

original: sems can thams cad la ye shes chen po'i byin gyis rlob pa bsod nams chen po 'phags pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la ye shes chen po'i byin gyis rlob pa bsod nams chen po 'phags pa /
translated: He is the noble one who is greatly meritorious, who blesses all sentient beings with great wisdom.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams mtha' yas pa'i zhing /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams mtha' yas pa'i zhing /
translated: He is the field of merit for all beings.

original: sems can thams cad la yon tan dang / ye shes kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'phel bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yon tan dang / ye shes kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'phel bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: He is the one who increases the aggregates of all good qualities and wisdom for all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bsod nams kyi mtha'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang / bsod nams kyi mtha'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten supreme, unsurpassed, sublime ornaments of the culmination of the merit of the blessed buddhas, their great love, great compassion, and great merit.‚Äù

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors,

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o ////
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o ////
translated: these are the supreme, unsurpassed, sublime ornaments of the buddhas, the blessed ones.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa /
translated: The Noble Teaching of the Inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: PART TWO

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the victorious ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag po dbang gi chos bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag po dbang gi chos bcu ste /
translated: The bhagavƒÅn buddhas have ten sovereign dharmas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi bdag po dbang gis chos thams cad snang bar mdzad pa dang / mtha' med pa'i tshig dang / 'bru la spobs pa chags pa med pas chos ma lus pa thams cad yongs su ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi bdag po dbang gis chos thams cad snang bar mdzad pa dang / mtha' med pa'i tshig dang / 'bru la spobs pa chags pa med pas chos ma lus pa thams cad yongs su ston pa ste /
translated: The bhagavƒÅn buddhas, sovereign over all phenomena, illuminate all phenomena with sovereign power, and they reveal all phenomena without exception through unimpeded eloquence in words and syllables.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos dang po'o //
translated: This is the first sovereign power of the bhagavƒÅn buddhas.

original: @265b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos ji ltar sems can gnas pa'i 'dul zhing yongs su smin pa de ltar smon lam dang / chos ston te /
analyzed: @265b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos ji ltar sems can gnas pa'i 'dul zhing yongs su smin pa de ltar smon lam dang / chos ston te /
translated: The bhagavƒÅn buddhas, sovereign over all phenomena, teach the Dharma and make aspirations in accordance with the ripening of the fields of beings to be tamed.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i chos gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i chos gnyis so //
translated: This is the second sovereign power of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rnam pa drug tu g-yos kyang sems can gcig la'ang gnod pa med pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rnam pa drug tu g-yos kyang sems can gcig la'ang gnod pa med pa /
translated: The Lord Buddha, with his mastery, can cause all worlds without exception to quake in six ways, yet without harming a single being.

original: tshad med grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with immeasurable, countless ornaments.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu 'deg pa dang / 'jog pa dang / sad pa dang / 'phen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig dang / phyogs gcig nas gcig tu 'jog kyang sems can gyi khams kun nas gti mi mug cing the tshom med de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu 'deg pa dang / 'jog pa dang / sad pa dang / 'phen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig dang / phyogs gcig nas gcig tu 'jog kyang sems can gyi khams kun nas gti mi mug cing the tshom med de /
translated: He can lift up and put down all worlds without exception to the ends of space, one after another, and can put one world in another, and one direction in another, without the beings in those worlds being confused or doubtful.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos gsum mo //
translated: This is the third attribute of mastery of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad ye shes kyi byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad ye shes kyi byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The Lord Buddha, with his mastery, can, in a single instant of mind, bless all worlds without exception with his wisdom.

original: rgyan sna tshogs 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu byin gyis rlob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lhab lhub dang / rgyan ston pa dang / grangs med pa'i bskal par 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus su ston cing lhab lhub dang /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu byin gyis rlob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lhab lhub dang / rgyan ston pa dang / grangs med pa'i bskal par 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus su ston cing lhab lhub dang /
translated: They can bless the ornaments of one world realm after another. They can display ornaments and finery in all world realms. For countless eons, they can display their bodies in all worlds without any afflictions and display ornaments and finery.

original: rgyan thams cad kyi kha dog mi zad par ston pa dang / @266a *//
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyi kha dog mi zad par ston pa dang / @266a *//
translated: They manifest various ornaments from one world system to another. They display ornaments and adornments in all world systems. For countless eons, they display their bodies in all worlds without afflictions, and they display all ornaments and adornments without exhausting their colors.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu kun 'brang bar byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu kun 'brang bar byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: They manifest all pure buddha fields as a single buddha field.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four dharmas of the empowerment of lordship of the bhagavƒÅn buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gzigs nas sems can gcig gi phyir brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par skyil mo krung mi 'jig pa gang zag de la dgongs kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gzigs nas sems can gcig gi phyir brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par skyil mo krung mi 'jig pa gang zag de la dgongs kyang /
translated: The Lord Buddha sees sentient beings who are to be trained by a buddha and, for the sake of a single sentient being, he remains in the cross-legged posture for inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / thugs la skyo ba mi mnga' zhing 'dul ba'i dus su de las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / thugs la skyo ba mi mnga' zhing 'dul ba'i dus su de las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Although he has this intention, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs body and mind are not weary, and he does not pass beyond the time of training.üîΩJust as he does for each individual, in the same way, he gradually remains, empowered with control over life, until the end of the world systems of the entire universe.

original: ji ltar gang zag re re la'ang de bzhin du rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mthar tshe la dbang ba byin gyis brlabs te bzhugs kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la kun tu bsnyengs pa mi mnga'/
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag re re la'ang de bzhin du rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mthar tshe la dbang ba byin gyis brlabs te bzhugs kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la kun tu bsnyengs pa mi mnga'/
translated: The Lord Buddha is not at all afraid,

original: skyo ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: skyo ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: and he is not weary.

original: de bzhin du sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gang zag gi phyir rim pas rab tu skyong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gang zag gi phyir rim pas rab tu skyong ste /
translated: In the same way, he gradually protects the entire realm of sentient beings for the sake of the individuals who are to be trained by a buddha.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos lnga'o //
translated: These are the five dharmas of the empowerment of the lord of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos sems kyi skad cig ma de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du 'brang zhing gshegs @266b nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos sems kyi skad cig ma de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du 'brang zhing gshegs @266b nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThe lord of the buddhas, the bhagavƒÅn, in that instant of mind, having gone to all the worlds in all the world systems,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'gyur ba rgya mtsho med pa bcu rdul yab ma lus pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings gcig nas gcig tu thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dra ba bzlog cing tshad med par gshegs te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'gyur ba rgya mtsho med pa bcu rdul yab ma lus pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings gcig nas gcig tu thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dra ba bzlog cing tshad med par gshegs te /
translated: having blessed all the worlds in the ocean of the world systems in the ten directions, having turned the irreversible wheel of the Dharma, and having taught the realm of phenomena,

original: chos kyi dbyings ston pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to; 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos drug go /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ston pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to; 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos drug go /
translated: these are the six dharmas of the empowerment of the lord of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag pos sems kyi skad cig ma la sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i phyir sems kyi skad cig ma la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang 'di ltar mngon du rdzogs
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag pos sems kyi skad cig ma la sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i phyir sems kyi skad cig ma la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang 'di ltar mngon du rdzogs
translated: The blessed buddhas, in order to tame the realms of sentient beings in a single moment of mind, fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood in a single moment of mind.

original: par sangs rgyas pa'ang med /
analyzed: par sangs rgyas pa'ang med /
translated: However, it is like this: there is no full awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las mngon par sangs rgyas pa'ang med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las mngon par sangs rgyas pa'ang med /
translated: There is no full awakening to all the qualities of a buddha.

original: mngon du rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'ang med /
analyzed: mngon du rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'ang med /
translated: There is no future full awakening.

original: slob pa'i sa la gnas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub tu phye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsgribs par med par rtogs shing rigs pa'ang med de /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa la gnas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub tu phye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsgribs par med par rtogs shing rigs pa'ang med de /
translated: There is no abiding on the level of training, no distinction of full awakening, and no realization or lineage of all the qualities of a buddha being unobstructed.

original: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rnam par sprul pa chen po'i yul rgyun mi gcod cing dpag tu med pa'i ye shes brnyes te /
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas rnam par sprul pa chen po'i yul rgyun mi gcod cing dpag tu med pa'i ye shes brnyes te /
translated: In order to tame sentient beings, the buddhas continuously manifest the great realm of emanations and attain immeasurable wisdom.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi @267a *//
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi @267a *//
translated: This is the nature of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bdun no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bdun no //
translated: This is the seventh quality of the lord buddhas.üîΩ‚Äú

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos gang spyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de snyan gyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /üîΩgang snyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de shangs kyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag pos gang spyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de snyan gyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub / gang snyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de shangs kyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
translated: The buddhas, the blessed ones, accomplish the buddha activities with the eye faculty that they accomplish with the ear faculty.üîΩThey accomplish the buddha activities with the ear faculty that they accomplish with the nose faculty.

original: gang shangs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de ljags kyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
analyzed: gang shangs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de ljags kyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
translated: They accomplish the buddha activities with the nose faculty that they accomplish with the tongue faculty.

original: gang ljags kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de sku'i skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
analyzed: gang ljags kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de sku'i skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
translated: They accomplish the buddha activities with the tongue faculty that they accomplish with the body faculty.

original: gang sku'i skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de thugs kyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
analyzed: gang sku'i skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de thugs kyi skye mched kyis kun tu sgrub /
translated: They accomplish the buddha activities with the body faculty that they accomplish with the mind faculty.

original: gang thugs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de'i bar gyis 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du sna tshogs su rtsom zhing 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par phye ba brnyes te /
analyzed: gang thugs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa de'i bar gyis 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du sna tshogs su rtsom zhing 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par phye ba brnyes te /
translated: By means of the mental sense base, the buddhas perform buddha activities in all the worlds without exception, in all their variety.

original: de bzhin du rtsom pa re res sgrub cing sprul pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rtsom pa gcig ji lta ba bzhin du rtsom pa ma lus pa thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsom pa re res sgrub cing sprul pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rtsom pa gcig ji lta ba bzhin du rtsom pa ma lus pa thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
translated: And just as they do this in one world, so they do so in all worlds, in all their variety.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos brgyad do //
translated: This is the eighth power of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang pos rang gi sku'i ba spu gcig gi pu gar sems can re re'i lus kyang brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i @267b sangs rgyas kyi ltar che ba'i sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad bcug cing nang
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang pos rang gi sku'i ba spu gcig gi pu gar sems can re re'i lus kyang brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i @267b sangs rgyas kyi ltar che ba'i sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad bcug cing nang
translated: The buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, can place in a single pore of their body all the worlds of the universe, with their three-thousandfold universes, great triple-thousandfold universes, and so on, up to and including the worlds of the buddhas‚Äô pure fields.

original: du 'dus par mdzad de /
analyzed: du 'dus par mdzad de /
translated: They all gather together in one place.

original: de la sems can re res kyang bskal pa grangs med par gnas kyang sems can de dag la gnod pa'ang med /
analyzed: de la sems can re res kyang bskal pa grangs med par gnas kyang sems can de dag la gnod pa'ang med /
translated: Even if each sentient being were to remain for countless eons, they would not be harmed.

original: kun tu gnod pa med do //
analyzed: kun tu gnod pa med do //
translated: There would be no harm at all.üîΩThey go from one inexpressibly inexpressible world system to another world system with a single step.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu gom pa gcig gis gshegs te 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gis sangs rgyas byung zhing sangs rgyas byung ba dang / de dag gis brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'das te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu gom pa gcig gis gshegs te 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gis sangs rgyas byung zhing sangs rgyas byung ba dang / de dag gis brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'das te /
translated: They know that the buddhas arise in those world systems, and that they arise from those world systems.

original: de'i dbang gis sems can gyi snying pos brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems can gyi snying pos brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar shes so //
translated: They turn the inexpressibly inexpressible Dharma wheel by the power of the essence of sentient beings.

original: de la ba spu'i bu ga'i sems can brjod du med pa dag gcig nas gcig tu sangs rgyas su gyur te /
analyzed: de la ba spu'i bu ga'i sems can brjod du med pa dag gcig nas gcig tu sangs rgyas su gyur te /
translated: In that way, the inexpressibly inexpressible sentient beings in each pore become buddhas one after another.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brjod du med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brjod du med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing /
translated: One after another, they turn the inexpressibly inexpressible Dharma wheel.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brjod du med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ston /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brjod du med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ston /
translated: He reveals the realm of phenomena, which is inexpressible from one to another.

original: gcig nas gcig tu 'das pa brjod du med pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu ma 'ongs pa brjod du med pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu da ltar byung ba brjod du med pa snang bar byed /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu 'das pa brjod du med pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu ma 'ongs pa brjod du med pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu da ltar byung ba brjod du med pa snang bar byed /
translated: He reveals the past, which is inexpressible from one to another, the future, which is inexpressible from one to another, and the present, which is inexpressible from one to another.

original: mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i nam mkha'i khams skabs byed pa ston /üîΩsems can thams cad 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / thams cad skye ba'i skye mched dang / bsgribs pa med pa dang / 'dod @268a *//
analyzed: mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i nam mkha'i khams skabs byed pa ston / sems can thams cad 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / thams cad skye ba'i skye mched dang / bsgribs pa med pa dang / 'dod @268a *//
translated: He reveals the realm of space, which is without end or middle.

original: chags la yongs su spyod par 'jug pa mkhyen te /
analyzed: chags la yongs su spyod par 'jug pa mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the coming and going of all beings, the place of birth of all, the absence of obscuration, and the engagement in the enjoyment of desire.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos dgu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine qualities of the mastery of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag pos chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad padmo'i rgyan chen pos brgyan te padmo'i snying po'i seng ge'i gdan la de bzhin gshegs pa re re bzhugs pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / sku dpag tu med pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag pos chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad padmo'i rgyan chen pos brgyan te padmo'i snying po'i seng ge'i gdan la de bzhin gshegs pa re re bzhugs pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / sku dpag tu med pa dang /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, the Lords, adorn the entire realm of phenomena with a great array of lotuses, and each TathƒÅgata sits on a lion throne in the center of a lotus, in the realm of all phenomena, with an immeasurable body,

original: byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par rol pa ston te /
analyzed: byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par rol pa ston te /
translated: displaying the play of all Buddhas, having fully awakened to enlightenment.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pa de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam par sems can gyi snying po re re sems kyi skad cig ma la byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pa de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam par sems can gyi snying po re re sems kyi skad cig ma la byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: Just as with one TathƒÅgata, so also in every atom of all world systems, he empowers each essence of sentient beings in every moment of mind, equal to the number of atoms in all world systems.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi skad cig ma thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi skad cig ma thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as in one moment of mind, so also in every moment of mind.

original: ji ltar padma'i le'u dang; rnam par dag cing mngon du rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ltar chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / med bcu rdul yab brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar padma'i le'u dang; rnam par dag cing mngon du rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ltar chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / med bcu rdul yab brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Just as in the chapter on the lotus, the entire realm of phenomena is completely and perfectly awakened, and in the same way, all the buddha realms, which are pure and beyond expression, are completely and perfectly awakened.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan sna tshogs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su rtsom pa sna tshogs kyi rim pa dang / med bcu rdul @268b yab brjod du med pa'i zhing rnam par dag pa dang / sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid sna tshogs med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan sna tshogs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su rtsom pa sna tshogs kyi rim pa dang / med bcu rdul @268b yab brjod du med pa'i zhing rnam par dag pa dang / sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid sna tshogs med pa dang /
translated: The various inconceivable adornments, the various stages of the world systems, the pure buddha realms beyond expression, the various characteristics, and the absence of various characteristics,

original: rigs med bcu rdul yab tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa'i dus 'gyur ba dang / mi chags pa ston pa dang / tshad med pa'i blo rgyas pa'i dad pa dang / skad cig ma sna tshogs dang / gnas med pa dang / skad cig ma bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
analyzed: rigs med bcu rdul yab tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa'i dus 'gyur ba dang / mi chags pa ston pa dang / tshad med pa'i blo rgyas pa'i dad pa dang / skad cig ma sna tshogs dang / gnas med pa dang / skad cig ma bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
translated: the ten kinds of non-lineage, the measure of the father, the immeasurable time, the change, the non-attachment, the faith of immeasurable mental expansion, the various moments, the non-abiding, the inconceivable moments,

original: tshad med par gshegs pa dang / sems kyi skad cig ma dang / sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la thams cad ston te /
analyzed: tshad med par gshegs pa dang / sems kyi skad cig ma dang / sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la thams cad ston te /
translated: the immeasurable going, the mind-moment, and the teaching of everything in a single mind-moment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mchod du mdzad pa ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mchod du mdzad pa ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not make offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten dharmas of the lordship power of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious One!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag po'i dbang gi chos bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten dharmas of the lordship power of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious One!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su rdzogs pa bcu ste; bcu gang zhe na /üîΩgang gis bsod nams brgya ba'i mtshan mtshan re re nas yongs su dag nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste; 'di ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su rdzogs pa bcu ste; bcu gang zhe na / gang gis bsod nams brgya ba'i mtshan mtshan re re nas yongs su dag nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste; 'di ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang po'o //
translated: What are the ten?üîΩThe first perfect quality is that the blessed buddhas, having perfected the one hundred merits of each of the major marks, manifest perfect awakening to buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang @269a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang @269a *//
translated: The second perfect quality is that the blessed buddhas, having perfected all the qualities of the buddhas, manifest perfect awakening to buddhahood.

original: rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
analyzed: rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
translated: the buddhas, the bhagavats, who have perfected all roots of virtue and fully awakened to enlightenment;üîΩthe buddhas, the bhagavats, who have perfected the source of all qualities and the perfection of pure conduct;üîΩthe buddhas, the bhagavats, who have perfected the training and ripening of sentient beings and fully awakened to enlightenment;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can 'dul zhing yongs su smin par mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi bdag po 'gro ba thams cad gang gis kyang zil gyis mi gnon pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can 'dul zhing yongs su smin par mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi bdag po 'gro ba thams cad gang gis kyang zil gyis mi gnon pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
translated: the buddhas, the bhagavats, who have perfected the state of being a buddha, which cannot be surpassed by any being in the world;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhing yongs su dag par mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhing yongs su dag par mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang /
translated: The blessed buddhas attain perfect awakening with omniscient wisdom after perfecting omniscient wisdom.üîΩThe blessed buddhas attain perfect awakening with the form body that displays the signs and features of a buddha without delusion after perfecting the display of the signs and features of a buddha without delusion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan dang / dpe byad gti mug med par ston pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba @269b dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan dang / dpe byad gti mug med par ston pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba @269b dang; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: The blessed buddhas attain perfect awakening with the equality of all thus-gone ones after perfecting the equality of all thus-gone ones.

original: rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: The blessed buddhas attain perfect awakening with the performance of all buddha activities after perfecting the performance of all buddha activities.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten perfections of the qualities of the buddhas, the inconceivable methods of the blessed buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs ma yin pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen nas spros pa med pa dang / dge ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs ston cing snang bar mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs ma yin pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen nas spros pa med pa dang / dge ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs ston cing snang bar mdzad de /
translated: The blessed buddhas know all phenomena that are not blessed by the buddhas, yet they display and manifest the unfabricated, the virtuous, and the blessings of the buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad bltar med pa dang / phan tshun shes par mi rung ba dang / ma bcing ba dang / ma grol ba dang / gzung du med pa dang / reg par mi rung ba dang / ma byung ba'i chos thams cad la mnga' dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad bltar med pa dang / phan tshun shes par mi rung ba dang / ma bcing ba dang / ma grol ba dang / gzung du med pa dang / reg par mi rung ba dang / ma byung ba'i chos thams cad la mnga' dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes shing /
translated: The blessed buddhas have attained the perfection of the highest mastery over all phenomena that are invisible, mutually incomprehensible, unfettered, liberated, ungraspable, intangible, and unarisen.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos de dag thams cad yang dag pa nyid dang / de kho na dang / ma nor @270a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos de dag thams cad yang dag pa nyid dang / de kho na dang / ma nor @270a *//
translated: The blessed buddhas have attained the perfection of the highest mastery over all phenomena that are real, as they are, unmistaken,üîΩunerring, and unaltered, as well as over all phenomena that are selfless and ungraspable.

original: pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i chos thams cad dang / bdag med pa dang / gzung ba med pa'i chos rnams kyi de kho na'i mtha' la chags pa med pa'i dbang du gyur pa de la dbang gis chen po bslabs te /
analyzed: pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i chos thams cad dang / bdag med pa dang / gzung ba med pa'i chos rnams kyi de kho na'i mtha' la chags pa med pa'i dbang du gyur pa de la dbang gis chen po bslabs te /
translated: They have trained in the great mastery over the limit of reality of all phenomena.

original: bslab pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing chos thams cad la gzigs te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing chos thams cad la gzigs te /
translated: They follow the training and see all phenomena.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second skillful means of the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma thams cad kyi mtha' dang bral zhing mtshan ma thams cad la mi gnas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma thams cad kyi mtha' dang bral zhing mtshan ma thams cad la mi gnas pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe buddhas, the blessed ones, are free from the extremes of all characteristics and do not abide in any characteristics.

original: mtshan ma mngon par mkhyen pas mi chags pa de'i ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ji ltar ngo bo nyid smra ba'i tshul gyis rjes su song ba /
analyzed: mtshan ma mngon par mkhyen pas mi chags pa de'i ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ji ltar ngo bo nyid smra ba'i tshul gyis rjes su song ba /
translated: They are not attached to the knowledge of characteristics, and they follow the way of speaking about the nature of things, their lack of nature, and their nature.

original: grangs med pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan pa'i chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa sna tshogs kyi zhing thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang / spyod pa'i mtshan ma zad par ston pa /
analyzed: grangs med pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan pa'i chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa sna tshogs kyi zhing thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang / spyod pa'i mtshan ma zad par ston pa /
translated: They reveal the exhaustion of the characteristics of the form of the innumerable characteristics of the pure dharmakƒÅya and the characteristics of all the various realms and conduct.

original: mun pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po yang dag par rab tu 'chang ba mun pa'i 'gro ba thams cad la sgron ma chen pos snang ba ston te /
analyzed: mun pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po yang dag par rab tu 'chang ba mun pa'i 'gro ba thams cad la sgron ma chen pos snang ba ston te /
translated: They hold the aggregate of the perception of darkness and reveal the light of the great lamp to all those who are in the darkness.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third skillful means of the buddhas, blessed ones.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba la ma chags pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / chos kyi @270b dbyings la mi gnas pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba la ma chags pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / chos kyi @270b dbyings la mi gnas pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are free from attachment to the past, future, and present, and do not dwell in the dharmadhƒÅtu of the past, future, or present.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma byung ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas byung ba snang bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma byung ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas byung ba snang bar mdzad pa /
translated: They manifest the appearance of the past, future, and present buddhas who have not arisen and who have the characteristic of suchness.

original: brjod du med par bstan pa; de ltar tshad med pa'i rigs kyi phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi phyir lta ba /
analyzed: brjod du med par bstan pa; de ltar tshad med pa'i rigs kyi phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi phyir lta ba /
translated: They teach the inexpressible, and in that way, because of the immeasurable family, they are the view of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul kun tu gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul kun tu gzigs pa ste /
translated: They see the entire domain of the buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth skillful means of the buddhas, blessed ones.üîΩ‚Äú

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du mi byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du mi byed pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddha does not engage in physical, verbal, or mental activity.

original: blang ba med pa dang / rgya med pa'i mtha' la gnas pa /
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / rgya med pa'i mtha' la gnas pa /
translated: He abides in the limit of non-acceptance and non-rejection.üîΩHe has gone beyond the stage of the Dharma of non-discarding, and he has turned away from the conduct of the limitless treasury of uncertain aspects and the accumulation of infinite collections.

original: dor ba med pa'i chos kyi gnas kyi pha rol tu song ba ma nges pa'i rnam pa'i mdzod dang / grangs kyi spyod pa las log par tshogs mtha' yas pa sgrub pa dang / sna tshogs kyi rim pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grangs su gtogs pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: dor ba med pa'i chos kyi gnas kyi pha rol tu song ba ma nges pa'i rnam pa'i mdzod dang / grangs kyi spyod pa las log par tshogs mtha' yas pa sgrub pa dang / sna tshogs kyi rim pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grangs su gtogs pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: He has attained the various stages that belong to the categories of the mundane and supramundane.

original: bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi lta ba tshad med mtha' yas pa'i rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs mngon par 'du mdzad pa /
analyzed: bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi lta ba tshad med mtha' yas pa'i rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs mngon par 'du mdzad pa /
translated: He manifests the various kinds of limitless, boundless, and unobstructed wisdom views and miracles.

original: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sems can rnams 'dul zhing rnam par rig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sems can rnams 'dul zhing rnam par rig par byed pa ste /
translated: He trains and makes sentient beings aware of the entire realm of phenomena.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth skillful means of the buddhas, blessed ones.

original: chos thams cad bltar med pa dang / sna tshogs med par song ba de ni rim pa med par song @271a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad bltar med pa dang / sna tshogs med par song ba de ni rim pa med par song @271a *//
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are beyond seeing, beyond variety, beyond stages,

original: ba; ma byung bar song ba /
analyzed: ba; ma byung bar song ba /
translated: beyond arising,

original: mtshan nyid med par song ba /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par song ba /
translated: beyond characteristics,

original: sna tshogs med par song ba /
analyzed: sna tshogs med par song ba /
translated: beyond variety,

original: rgyan med par song ba /
analyzed: rgyan med par song ba /
translated: beyond adornment,

original: blang ba med par song ba /
analyzed: blang ba med par song ba /
translated: beyond grasping,

original: ngo bo nyid med par song zhing chos thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par song zhing chos thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: and beyond essence. The buddhas know all phenomena.

original: chos kyi klong las nges par 'byin pa rab tu mkhyen pa /
analyzed: chos kyi klong las nges par 'byin pa rab tu mkhyen pa /
translated: They know how to bring forth the expanse of phenomena.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos dang mi 'gal bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos dang mi 'gal bar mdzad pa /
translated: They do not contradict worldly phenomena.

original: yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med par lta ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med par lta ba /
translated: They view the absence of a true essence.

original: thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: They know everything and see everything.

original: ye shes kyis ma lus par gzigs pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyis ma lus par gzigs pa /
translated: They see everything with wisdom.

original: chos thams cad dbang gis snang bar mdzad cing de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las mi 'pho ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dbang gis snang bar mdzad cing de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las mi 'pho ste /
translated: They illuminate all phenomena with their power and do not move from the essence of suchness.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth skillful means of the buddhas, Bhagavats.

original: dus gcig tu mtshan ma gcig phan tshun rtogs shing mkhyen pa de chos gsha' mar 'jug pa yongs su mi gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam pa rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: dus gcig tu mtshan ma gcig phan tshun rtogs shing mkhyen pa de chos gsha' mar 'jug pa yongs su mi gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mnyam pa rnam par dag pa /
translated: ‚ÄúAt one time, the single sign is mutually realized and known. That is the nonabiding root of merit that engages with the genuine Dharma.

original: chos gsha' ma nyid dang / dus thams cad du mi gnas pa de la nyi ma gcig dang / zla ba phyed dang / lo gcig dang / lo brgya dang / bskal pa sdud pa dang 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos gsha' ma nyid dang / dus thams cad du mi gnas pa de la nyi ma gcig dang / zla ba phyed dang / lo gcig dang / lo brgya dang / bskal pa sdud pa dang 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'ang ma yin /
translated: That nonabiding in the genuine Dharma at all times is not engaged in by the single day, the half month, the year, the hundred years, or the eon.

original: ldog pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ldog pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not engaged in by the reversal.

original: tshad med pa'i dus dang / nyi ma gcig dang / yud tsam gyi dus dang / snga dro dang / nyi ma phyed kyi dus dang / phyem red dang / srod dang / nam gyi gung @271b dang; tho rengs kyi dus dang / nyi ma dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i dus dang / nyi ma gcig dang / yud tsam gyi dus dang / snga dro dang / nyi ma phyed kyi dus dang / phyem red dang / srod dang / nam gyi gung @271b dang; tho rengs kyi dus dang / nyi ma dang /
translated: It is not engaged in by the immeasurable time, the single day, the time of the moment, the morning, the noon, the afternoon, the evening, the midnight, the dawn, or the day.

original: grangs su gtogs pa'i dus dang / zhag bdun dang / zla ba phyed kyi dus dang / zla ba gcig dang / lo gcig dang / lo brgya'i dus dang / bskal pa gcig gi dus dang / tshad med /
analyzed: grangs su gtogs pa'i dus dang / zhag bdun dang / zla ba phyed kyi dus dang / zla ba gcig dang / lo gcig dang / lo brgya'i dus dang / bskal pa gcig gi dus dang / tshad med /
translated: the time of seven days, the time of half a month, the time of one month, the time of one year, the time of one hundred years, the time of one eon, the time of immeasurability,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: the time of innumerability, the time of inconceivability,

original: brjod du med pa'i dus dang / phyi ma'i dus kyi mtha'i bar du chos ston te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i dus dang / phyi ma'i dus kyi mtha'i bar du chos ston te /
translated: the time of inexpressibility, and the time of the end of the future, he teaches the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa'ang med /üîΩldog pa'ang med /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa'ang med / ldog pa'ang med /
translated: He does not abide in the wheel of the Dharma,üîΩnor does he turn away from it.

original: rgyun kyang mi gcod /üîΩsbyor ba'ang med /
analyzed: rgyun kyang mi gcod / sbyor ba'ang med /
translated: He does not cut off the continuum,üîΩnor does he join it.

original: mtshams su'ang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshams su'ang mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not change the intervals,

original: mi 'dor / mi 'pho /
analyzed: mi 'dor / mi 'pho /
translated: nor does he abandon, transfer,

original: mi g-yo / ring ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi g-yo / ring ba'ang ma yin /
translated: or move. He is not long,

original: de mtha' la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de mtha' la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: nor does he abide in the end.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyis thabs la mkhas pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyis thabs la mkhas pa bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh skillful means of the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / tshad med pa'i mi 'jigs pa brnyes pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / tshad med pa'i mi 'jigs pa brnyes pa /
translated: The buddhas, the blessed ones, have attained the entire realm of phenomena and immeasurable fearlessness.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa grangs med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa tshad med pa dang; so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa gnas pa med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa mtha' yas pa dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa grangs med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa tshad med pa dang; so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa gnas pa med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa mtha' yas pa dang /
translated: the innumerable correct understandings, the immeasurable correct understandings, the inexhaustible correct understandings, the nonabiding correct understandings, the limitless correct understandings,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa kun nas gzung ba med pa dang / de kho na nyid so so yang dag par rig pa dang / tshig dang / tshul dang / rtog pa so so'i yang dag par @272a *//
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa kun nas gzung ba med pa dang / de kho na nyid so so yang dag par rig pa dang / tshig dang / tshul dang / rtog pa so so'i yang dag par @272a *//
translated: the correct understandings, the unapprehended correct understandings, the correct understandings of reality, the correct understandings of words, methods, and concepts,

original: rig pa dang / chos thams cad so so yang dag par rig pa dang / ji ltar bsam pa dang / dad pa dang / dbang po dang / ji ltar btags pa'i chos rnams dang / chos kyi gzhung gi mtshams ston pa dang / de dang de dag tu brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i mdo sde bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi thog ma dang; bar ma dang /üîΩtha ma'i mdo yang dag par rab tu ston te /

translated: the name of the nonexistence of the present, the name of the nonexistence of beings, the name of the nonexistence of fields, the name of the nonexistence of phenomena, the name of the nonexistence of qualities, the name of the nonexistence of bodhisattvas, the name of the nonexistence of buddhas,

original: grangs med pa'i ming dang / grangs med pa ma yin pa'i ming dang / ma byung ba'i ming dang / mi 'gog pa'i ming dang / med pa'i ming dang / med pa ma yin pa'i ming dang / gcig ma yin pa'i ming @272b dang; rnam pa thams cad ma yin pa'i ming rang bzhin gyis brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: grangs med pa'i ming dang / grangs med pa ma yin pa'i ming dang / ma byung ba'i ming dang / mi 'gog pa'i ming dang / med pa'i ming dang / med pa ma yin pa'i ming dang / gcig ma yin pa'i ming @272b dang; rnam pa thams cad ma yin pa'i ming rang bzhin gyis brjod du med pa'o //
translated: the name of the incalculable, the name of the nonincalculable, the name of the nonarisen, the name of the unceasing, the name of the nonexistent, the name of the non-nonexistent, the name of the nonone, and the name of the nonall.

original: chos thams cad ni phyogs ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phyogs ma yin /
translated: All phenomena are not directions,

original: brdam yin / ngag gi lam gyi sgra dang bral ba /
analyzed: brdam yin / ngag gi lam gyi sgra dang bral ba /
translated: not signs, and free from the sounds of the path of speech.

original: sgra byung ba thams cad kyis ma bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: sgra byung ba thams cad kyis ma bsgrubs pa /
translated: They are not established by any arising sound.

original: ma bskyed pa dang / sna tshogs su bskyed pa dang / rnam pa gcig ma yin pa dang / rnam pa mang po ma yin pa dang / smra ba thams cad brjod du med pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pa /
analyzed: ma bskyed pa dang / sna tshogs su bskyed pa dang / rnam pa gcig ma yin pa dang / rnam pa mang po ma yin pa dang / smra ba thams cad brjod du med pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pa /
translated: He is not born, and he is born in various ways. He is not a single aspect, and he is not many aspects. He has attained the perfection of the ultimate inexpressibility of all speech.

original: kun tu mi rtogs pa'i yul mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kun tu mi rtogs pa'i yul mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with the non-performance of the object of non-conceptualization.

original: rtog pa dang / kun tu rtogs pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / kun tu rtogs pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa /
translated: He has stopped all thoughts, conceptual thoughts, and discursive thoughts.

original: smra ba thams cad la mi gnas pa gnas pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba thams cad la mi gnas pa gnas pa ste /
translated: He does not dwell in any speech, and he is the abode.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa dgu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine skillful means of the buddhas, the bhagavats.

original: gzugs kyi chos thams cad ma skyes par mkhyen te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos thams cad ma skyes par mkhyen te /
translated: ‚ÄúHe knows all phenomena of form to be unborn.

original: tshor ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ma yin /
translated: He is not feeling.

original: spros pa ma yin /
analyzed: spros pa ma yin /
translated: He is not conceptualization.

original: grangs ma yin /
analyzed: grangs ma yin /
translated: He is not a number.

original: 'du shes kyi spyod pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi spyod pa ma yin /
translated: He is not the activity of perception.

original: 'du byed ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed ma yin /
translated: He is not formation.

original: len pa ma yin /
analyzed: len pa ma yin /
translated: He is not grasping.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not consciousness.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhi bar rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi bar rab tu mkhyen /

original: skye mched med par 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings mi dmigs pa dang / chos thams cad mi 'jigs pa dang / chos thams cad ldang ba med do //
analyzed: skye mched med par 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings mi dmigs pa dang / chos thams cad mi 'jigs pa dang / chos thams cad ldang ba med do //
translated: the fearlessness of all phenomena, and the non-arising of all phenomena.

original: rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' dang mnyam pa /
translated: They are equal to space by nature.

original: chos thams cad dben pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa /
translated: All phenomena are void.

original: las ma yin pa /
analyzed: las ma yin pa /
translated: They are not actions.

original: spyod pa med pa las byung ba /üîΩma skyes @273a *//
analyzed: spyod pa med pa las byung ba / ma skyes @273a *//
translated: They arise from the absence of conduct.üîΩThey are unborn.

original: pa; ma byung ba /
analyzed: pa; ma byung ba /
translated: They do not occur.

original: grangs med par rtogs pa /
analyzed: grangs med par rtogs pa /
translated: They are realized as beyond number.

original: yod pa ma yin pa med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa med pa ma yin pa /
translated: They are not existent and not non-existent.

original: ma skyes pa /üîΩma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa / ma 'gags pa /
translated: They are unborn.üîΩThey are unceasing.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /
translated: They are not afflicted.

original: rnam par byang ba ma yin /üîΩming med pa /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma yin / ming med pa /
translated: They are not purified.üîΩThey are nameless.

original: gsha' ma ma yin pa /üîΩmi gnas pa /
analyzed: gsha' ma ma yin pa / mi gnas pa /
translated: They are not real.üîΩThey do not abide.

original: yongs su mi gnas pa /üîΩyongs su smin pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yongs su mi gnas pa / yongs su smin pa ma yin pa /
translated: They do not fully abide.üîΩThey are not fully ripened.

original: dul ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dul ba ma yin pa /
translated: They are not disciplined.

original: sems can med pa; sems can med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sems can med pa; sems can med pa ma yin pa /
translated: They are not sentient beings and not non-sentient beings.

original: srog med pa /
analyzed: srog med pa /
translated: They are not life.

original: srog med pa ma yin pa /üîΩrkyen med pa /
analyzed: srog med pa ma yin pa / rkyen med pa /
translated: They are not non-life.üîΩThey are not conditions.

original: rkyen med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rkyen med pa ma yin pa /
translated: They are not non-conditions.

original: rkyen dang / 'du ba med pa ma yin par chos thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: rkyen dang / 'du ba med pa ma yin par chos thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: He knows all phenomena to be neither conditions nor their assembly.

original: chos thams cad kyi dbyings ston pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbyings ston pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pa /

original: tshogs gsum pa rnam par gnas pas nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: tshogs gsum pa rnam par gnas pas nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: He has attained the three collections of teachings, which are the definitive, the indefinite, and the false, and the indefinite. He has attained the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, omniscient wisdom, and the four types of fearlessness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul chen po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul chen po ste /
translated: He has attained the great domain of the buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors,

analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu'o //
translated: these are the ten skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs yangs pa /
translated: O children of the Victorious One, this is the activity of the blessed buddhas, the vast and

original: @273b tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: @273b tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: boundless blessings of the buddhas, which are inconceivable,

original: lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa gang gis kyang tshad gzung par mi nus pa /
analyzed: lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa gang gis kyang tshad gzung par mi nus pa /
translated: beyond measure, and cannot be fathomed by anyone in the world.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'jug par mi nus pa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'jug par mi nus pa bcu ste /
translated: They are not accessible to any of the hearers or solitary realizers of the past, present, or future.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mtha' dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dga' ldan du skye ba ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' med pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mtha' dang / chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dga' ldan du skye ba ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' med pa dang /
translated: They are the display of birth in Tu·π£hita Heaven in the realm of space, the realm of phenomena, and all world systems in the ten directions; the display of the conduct of the bodhisattvas and the infinite activity of the buddhas;

original: kha dog tshad med pa dang / gzi brjid tshad med pa dang / snang ba tshad med pa dang / dbyings tshad med pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa tshang med pa dang / sgra sgrogs pa rnam par rig pa tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: kha dog tshad med pa dang / gzi brjid tshad med pa dang / snang ba tshad med pa dang / dbyings tshad med pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa tshang med pa dang / sgra sgrogs pa rnam par rig pa tshad med pa dang /
translated: They were endowed with immeasurable color, immeasurable splendor, immeasurable radiance, immeasurable space, immeasurable pure aspects of melodious speech, and immeasurable awareness of the proclamation of sound.

original: ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa la gnas pa dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi yul tshad med pa dang / mtha' dang / 'jig rten du bcas pa rjes su 'dzin pa dang bdud du bcas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa la gnas pa dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi yul tshad med pa dang / mtha' dang / 'jig rten du bcas pa rjes su 'dzin pa dang bdud du bcas /
translated: They were endowed with immeasurable samƒÅdhi, immeasurable wisdom and the domain of wisdom, and they cared for the world with its limits and its gods,

original: tshangs par bcas /
analyzed: tshangs par bcas /
translated: with its BrahmƒÅ,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa dang / skye dgu dang / lha dang / mir bcas pa dang / lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa dang / skye dgu dang / lha dang / mir bcas pa dang / lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: with its mendicants and brahmins, with its beings and gods, and with its world of asuras.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i byams pa chen po'i sbyod yul ba /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i byams pa chen po'i sbyod yul ba /
translated: They were endowed with the domain of great, unassailable love,

original: snying rje chen po la phyogs pa'i mtha' la phyogs pas sems can rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la phyogs pa'i mtha' la phyogs pas sems can rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: and they cared for beings by being oriented toward the limits of great compassion.

original: gzhan mtho ris su skye ba'i sems can @274a *//
analyzed: gzhan mtho ris su skye ba'i sems can @274a *//
translated: and other beings are born in the higher realms.üîΩ

original: rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: They are the ones who care for beings who are born in the higher realms.

original: bsod nams kyi stobs kyi dbang po phun sum tshogs pa dbang po rnam par dag pa dang / sems can shes yongs su dag pa'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi stobs kyi dbang po phun sum tshogs pa dbang po rnam par dag pa dang / sems can shes yongs su dag pa'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: They are the ones who care for beings who have the perfect power of the faculty of merit, the pure faculty, and the pure mind.

original: theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: They are the ones who care for beings who have the pure various vehicles.üîΩThey are the ones who care for beings who have perfected the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa; 'gro ba thams cad las 'byung ba'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa; 'gro ba thams cad las 'byung ba'i sems can yang rjes su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: They are the ones who care for beings who have emerged from all existences.üîΩThis is the perfect, pure conduct and activity of the blessed buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa rdzogs pa'o; ;dga' ldan gnas nas 'pho zhing yum gyi lhums su gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshe dang / bdag gi lus su skye ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa rdzogs pa'o; ;dga' ldan gnas nas 'pho zhing yum gyi lhums su gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshe dang / bdag gi lus su skye ba dang /
translated: They are the ones who descend from the Tu·π£ita realm and enter the womb of their mothers. They are the ones who have the life of a bodhisattva. They are the ones who are born in their last existence.

original: sgyu ma lta bur spyod pa dang / sprul pa lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la thug pa dang / mig yor lta bu'i rnam par rig pa dang / yul nam mkha' ltar tshad med par song ba /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur spyod pa dang / sprul pa lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la thug pa dang / mig yor lta bu'i rnam par rig pa dang / yul nam mkha' ltar tshad med par song ba /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par dag pa /
translated: the appearance that is like an echo,üîΩthe appearance that is like a city of gandharvas,üîΩthe appearance that is like a magical creation,üîΩthe appearance that is like a mirage,üîΩthe appearance that is like a reflection,
