original: rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / yid la byed pa chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / rnam par sprul pa chen po'i mdzod ston pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / yid la byed pa chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / rnam par sprul pa chen po'i mdzod ston pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: They perform buddha activities through their great miraculous powers, through the power of their great mental activity, and through revealing the treasury of great emanations.

original: ye shes chen po'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / ma las skyes pa de la gnas pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / yul chen po sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu brnyes pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / ma las skyes pa de la gnas pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / yul chen po sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu brnyes pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: They perform buddha activities through the orb of the sun of great wisdom, through abiding in the womb, and through attaining the great domain, the domain of the buddhas.

original: 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs mtha' yas pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / grangs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la rnam par spyod cing mnyam par 'jog pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs mtha' yas pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / grangs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la rnam par spyod cing mnyam par 'jog pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: They perform buddha activities through engaging in and resting in equipoise in countless great samƒÅdhis.üîΩThey perform buddha activities through rising from those samƒÅdhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dang / de dag las bzhengs pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tham dang / spyod pa dang po nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po'i mtha'i bar gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dang / de dag las bzhengs pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tham dang / spyod pa dang po nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po'i mtha'i bar gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: They perform buddha activities through the beginning, middle, and end, from the first stage of conduct up to the end of great parinirvƒÅ·πáa.üîΩThey perform buddha activities through blessing everything from this stage up to the second stage, and later teaching it in the enumeration of the world.

original: sa 'di nas gnyis kyi bar du thams cad byin gyis brlabs nas phyis 'jig rten gyi grangs la shes par ston pa dang / gzi brjid sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas @275a *//
analyzed: sa 'di nas gnyis kyi bar du thams cad byin gyis brlabs nas phyis 'jig rten gyi grangs la shes par ston pa dang / gzi brjid sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas @275a *//
translated: They perform buddha activities through various kinds of splendor in all worlds.

original: kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / gzhon nur gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / byang chub sems dpar gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / mngon par byung ba dang /
analyzed: kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / gzhon nur gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / byang chub sems dpar gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / mngon par byung ba dang /
translated: He performs the deeds of a buddha in all worlds as a child,üîΩas a bodhisattva, as one who has gone forth,üîΩas one who has attained perfect buddhahood, and as one who has turned the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang; sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang; sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: He performs the deeds of a buddha in all worlds through various means and through various manifestations.

original: 'jig rten dpag tu med pa dang / 'jig rten kun dang / phyogs thams cad du rgya mtsho'i rgyun dang; rigs kyis 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / zhing dang / dus ma lus pas 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /üîΩlas kyi rnam par smin pa ma lus pas 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sems can gyi rigs ma lus pas 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / 'chi 'pho zhing skye ba dang / rigs ma lus pas kyang 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten dpag tu med pa dang / 'jig rten kun dang / phyogs thams cad du rgya mtsho'i rgyun dang; rigs kyis 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / zhing dang / dus ma lus pas 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa ma lus pas 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sems can gyi rigs ma lus pas 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / 'chi 'pho zhing skye ba dang / rigs ma lus pas kyang 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: the world systems of the ten directions, the world systems of the four directions, the world systems of the four intermediate directions, the world systems of the zenith and the nadir, the world systems of the east, the world systems of the south, the world systems of the west, the world systems of the north, the world systems of the intermediate directions, the world systems of the zenith and the nadir, the world systems of the oceans, the world systems of the families, the world systems of the buddhas‚Äô activities, the world systems of the fields, the world systems of the times, the world systems of the ripening of karma, the world systems of the families of beings, the world systems of death and birth, and the world systems of the families of death and birth.üîΩ

original: sprul pa chen po dang / rigs dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / @275b chos dran pa'i sgo'i 'khor los kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: sprul pa chen po dang / rigs dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / @275b chos dran pa'i sgo'i 'khor los kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: the world systems of the ten directions, the world systems of the four directions, the world systems of the four intermediate directions, the world systems of the zenith and the nadir, the world systems of the east, the world systems of the south, the world systems of the west, the world systems of the north, the world systems of the intermediate directions, the world systems of the zenith and the nadir, the world systems of the ocean, the world systems of the lineage, the world systems of the activities of the buddhas, the world systems of the field, the world systems of the time, the world systems of the ripening of karma, the world systems of the lineage of beings, the world systems of birth and death, the world systems of the great emanations, the world systems of the lineage of the buddhas, and the world systems of the wheel of the door of mindfulness of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second deed of the buddhas.

original: dge bar spyod pa las rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba thams cad dang / ye shes dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba bstan pa'i rjes su song ba dang / sems can 'dul zhing rjes su chud par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge bar spyod pa las rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba thams cad dang / ye shes dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba bstan pa'i rjes su song ba dang / sems can 'dul zhing rjes su chud par byed pa dang /
translated: The deed of the buddhas is to be understood as being based on the purification of the practice of virtue, on the purification of all births, of knowledge, and of conduct, on the demonstration of birth, on the conversion and guidance of sentient beings,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can rnams la dogs pa'i slas ston pa'i rjes su song zhing sangs rgyas thams cad 'dod chags dang bral te gnas la gnas pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can rnams la dogs pa'i slas ston pa'i rjes su song zhing sangs rgyas thams cad 'dod chags dang bral te gnas la gnas pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang /
translated: on the completion of all roots of virtue, on the demonstration of the absence of fear in sentient beings, on the absence of pride in the buddhas, and on the absence of dwelling in the buddhas‚Äô dwelling in detachment and in their non-dwelling.

original: thams cad du lus mngon par sgrub pa dang / thams cad du gnas pa med pa'i lus yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / g-yog 'khor thams cad rnam par dag par nan tan byed pa dang / chos ston cing smra ba rjod pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad du lus mngon par sgrub pa dang / thams cad du gnas pa med pa'i lus yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / g-yog 'khor thams cad rnam par dag par nan tan byed pa dang / chos ston cing smra ba rjod pa dang /
translated: They manifest bodies everywhere. They perfect bodies that are not located anywhere. They practice to purify all their retinues. They teach the Dharma and speak and express themselves.

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang po smad pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyes pa rtogs pa ji ltar spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ston pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa'i sems can rnams 'dul ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang; ji ltar yongs su smin pa 'dul ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang po smad pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyes pa rtogs pa ji ltar spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ston pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa'i sems can rnams 'dul ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang; ji ltar yongs su smin pa 'dul ba dang /
translated: They show the ripening of roots of virtue that are practiced by those who have the faults of all worlds. They tame beings according to their location. They ripen beings who are not ripe. They tame those who are ripe.

original: thabs la mkhas pa grangs med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa las mi ldog par ston pa dang / spyod pa'i sgo sna tshogs kyi chos snang bar byed pa dang / gnas med pa'i rnam pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa grangs med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa las mi ldog par ston pa dang / spyod pa'i sgo sna tshogs kyi chos snang bar byed pa dang / gnas med pa'i rnam pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa byed pa dang /
translated: It is to accomplish countless skillful means. It is to demonstrate the activities of the buddhas without turning away. It is to illuminate the Dharma through various gateways of conduct. It is to purify the thoughts of beings who have no basis.

original: snying rje chen po skyes pa'i chos kyi sprin mngon par 'bebs par byed pa dang / sbrang bu 'gro ba ltar byams pa la 'jug cing cho 'phrul gsum yongs su 'bebs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la lta ba rnam par rig cing slas kyi dbus na 'dug pa ston pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po skyes pa'i chos kyi sprin mngon par 'bebs par byed pa dang / sbrang bu 'gro ba ltar byams pa la 'jug cing cho 'phrul gsum yongs su 'bebs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la lta ba rnam par rig cing slas kyi dbus na 'dug pa ston pa dang /
translated: It is to rain down the Dharma of the cloud of great compassion. It is to enter into love like the movement of a bee and to rain down the three miracles. It is to be aware of the view of all buddhas and to demonstrate sitting in the midst of a harem.

original: de las mtha'i mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ston pa dang / ye shes chen po @276b la gnas pas gnon cing sgribs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / las kyi mtha'i chos gsum la thabs mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de las mtha'i mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ston pa dang / ye shes chen po @276b la gnas pas gnon cing sgribs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / las kyi mtha'i chos gsum la thabs mkhas pa ste /
translated: The third is the deeds of the buddhas in the world systems at the end of the end of the end, in the world systems without end or middle, and the accomplishment of the unobstructed higher knowledge of the buddhas through abiding in great pristine awareness.üîΩThe fourth is the skillful means of the three aspects of the end of action.

original: lus kyi las shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / ngag gis mi 'phro ba'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / yid kyi las zab mo chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad de /
analyzed: lus kyi las shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / ngag gis mi 'phro ba'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / yid kyi las zab mo chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad de /
translated: The buddhas accomplish the welfare of sentient beings through the skillful means of the extremely pure physical action, the extremely pure pristine awareness of the unerring speech, and the profound mental action that has reached the end of nonattachment.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third deed of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.üîΩThe fourth is the deed of the buddhas that is accomplished through the power of the buddhas‚Äô pristine awareness.

original: mngon par byung ba'i rnam par rgyal ba chen pos slas tshad med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa yid du 'ong ba spangs te /
analyzed: mngon par byung ba'i rnam par rgyal ba chen pos slas tshad med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa yid du 'ong ba spangs te /
translated: The buddhas, through the great victory of renunciation, abandon the pleasing retinue of immeasurable size and ornament.

original: 'byung ba'i spyod pa ston cing 'jig rten gnas pa'i sems can 'dzud pa dang / 'jig rten mngon par chags par 'gyur bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi grangs mi rtog go zhes shes par byed pa dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa zlog par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i spyod pa ston cing 'jig rten gnas pa'i sems can 'dzud pa dang / 'jig rten mngon par chags par 'gyur bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi grangs mi rtog go zhes shes par byed pa dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa zlog par byed pa dang /
translated: They teach the conduct of the elements and introduce to the world the beings who dwell there. They cause the world to become attached and make it understood that the world is not to be conceptualized. They turn back the various attachments of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi dga' ba'i sred pa gcod pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'jig rten spyod du 'jug pa dang / don thams cad rjes su dran par byed pa dang / 'byung ba'i don gyi phyir 'brang bar byed pa dang / khyim pa'i mtshan ma yongs su gtong bar ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dga' ba'i sred pa gcod pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'jig rten spyod du 'jug pa dang / don thams cad rjes su dran par byed pa dang / 'byung ba'i don gyi phyir 'brang bar byed pa dang / khyim pa'i mtshan ma yongs su gtong bar ston pa dang /
translated: They cut through the craving for worldly pleasures, introduce the world to the abandonment of afflictions, cause the recollection of all meanings, and follow for the sake of the meaning of the elements. They teach the relinquishment of the marks of householders.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos la sbyor zhing gnas par byed pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i @277a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos la sbyor zhing gnas par byed pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i @277a *//
translated: They connect and establish beings in the Dharma of the absence of afflictions, fulfill their previous aspirations, and cause them to attain the inconceivable.

original: yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor snang bar byed pa dang / ye shes chen po'i dkyil 'khor so sor rnyed par byed cing sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa'i rab rib la lta ba dang / bdag bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pas 'gro ba thams cad nye bar khrid pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor snang bar byed pa dang / ye shes chen po'i dkyil 'khor so sor rnyed par byed cing sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa'i rab rib la lta ba dang / bdag bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pas 'gro ba thams cad nye bar khrid pa dang /
translated: They illuminate the ma·πá·∏çala of qualities, cause the ma·πá·∏çala of great wisdom to be individually attained, and eliminate the cataracts of ignorance of sentient beings.üîΩThey are the field of merit for me, and they lead all beings.üîΩThey praise all roots of virtue and all roots of virtue produced from the buddhas to all beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'du zhing sangs rgyas las bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye dgu thams cad la bsngags pa dang / bdag ye shes kyi don mthong ba'i ston pa dang / sems can rnams la rnam par dag pa'i sgo brjod pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'du zhing sangs rgyas las bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye dgu thams cad la bsngags pa dang / bdag ye shes kyi don mthong ba'i ston pa dang / sems can rnams la rnam par dag pa'i sgo brjod pa dang /
translated: They are the teachers who see the meaning of wisdom, and they proclaim the pure gateway to sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sgo sgrub tu 'dzud pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la 'byung ba'i sgo rab tu ston pa dang / mngon par 'byung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan kun sgreng bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sgo sgrub tu 'dzud pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la 'byung ba'i sgo rab tu ston pa dang / mngon par 'byung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan kun sgreng bar byed pa ste /
translated: They introduce sentient beings to the door of what is blameless and they reveal to the whole world the door of the arising of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth deed of the Lord Buddhas.

original: mdzad pa dang / ye shes du ma dang rab tu ldan pas byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs te /
analyzed: mdzad pa dang / ye shes du ma dang rab tu ldan pas byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs te /
translated: Endowed with many deeds and wisdoms, they go to the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin nas byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pas chos thams cad thugs su chud de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin nas byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pas chos thams cad thugs su chud de /
translated: Having perfected the wisdom of omniscience, they fully awaken to enlightenment and comprehend all phenomena.

original: bdud kyi stobs rab tu bcom zhing zil gyis mi non pa'i sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod dang / chos kyi dbyings ma lus ba thams cad du khyab par byed pa dang / byin gyi rlabs mi zad pa'i @277b mthas mtha' rnam par spangs pa dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi stobs rab tu bcom zhing zil gyis mi non pa'i sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod dang / chos kyi dbyings ma lus ba thams cad du khyab par byed pa dang / byin gyi rlabs mi zad pa'i @277b mthas mtha' rnam par spangs pa dang /
translated: the infinite extent of inexhaustible blessings,üîΩthe wisdom that has attained the domain of omniscience through attaining immeasurable conduct,üîΩthe complete accomplishment of the qualities of omniscience,

original: tshad med pa'i spyod pa rab tu brnyes pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la rnam par rol pa'i ye shes kyi don gyi rjes su gshegs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan bsgrubs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du spras pa'i gdan yongs su gsal ba dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i spyod pa rab tu brnyes pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la rnam par rol pa'i ye shes kyi don gyi rjes su gshegs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan bsgrubs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du spras pa'i gdan yongs su gsal ba dang /
translated: the manifestation of seats that pervade all worlds without exception,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i mchog rab tu bsnyes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i mchog rab tu bsnyes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang /
translated: It is to make bodhisattvas known in all the buddha realms. It is to be the supreme bodhisattva conduct. It is to be the retinue of all the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag pa'i khyad par gyi smon lam la rnam par lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad la dgongs pa dang / zab mo'i byang chub sems dpa' la chos zab mo'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang / tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i khyad par gyi smon lam la rnam par lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad la dgongs pa dang / zab mo'i byang chub sems dpa' la chos zab mo'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang / tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rtsom pa dang /
translated: It is to observe the special aspirations. It is to be the intention of all bodhisattvas. It is to turn the wheel of the profound Dharma for the profound bodhisattvas. It is to engage in the immeasurable domain of the buddhas.

original: brjod du med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung gnas kyi phyir 'brang zhing sna tshogs kyi spyad pa spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyi yul du byas pa dang /üîΩsems can la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par rig par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dbyer med pas 'byung ba'i sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa @278a *//
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung gnas kyi phyir 'brang zhing sna tshogs kyi spyad pa spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyi yul du byas pa dang / sems can la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par rig par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dbyer med pas 'byung ba'i sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa @278a *//
translated: the source of the inexpressible bodhisattvas, the conduct of the various bodhisattvas, the pure ma·πá·∏çala of the retinue of bodhisattvas, the domain of the blessing of the buddhas in all worlds,üîΩthe awareness of the roots of virtue in sentient beings, the bh≈´mi that arises from the indivisibility of all roots of virtue, the bodhisattvas‚Äô conduct,

original: mtha' yas pa'i stobs la gnas shing yon tan thams cad kyi khyad par ma lus pa'i mtha' rab tu rnyed de 'dug pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du 'gro ba dang / sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar 'gro ba dang / zhing thams cad du 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i stobs la gnas shing yon tan thams cad kyi khyad par ma lus pa'i mtha' rab tu rnyed de 'dug pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du 'gro ba dang / sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar 'gro ba dang / zhing thams cad du 'gro ba dang /
translated: the power of infinite bodhisattvas, the attainment of the end of all the distinctive qualities, the going to all worlds, the going to the end of all sentient beings, the going to all realms,

original: chos thams cad du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du 'gro ba dang / yongs su smin pa thams cad du 'gro ba dang / dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang / 'dul ba thams cad du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par rol par 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du 'gro ba dang / yongs su smin pa thams cad du 'gro ba dang / dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang / 'dul ba thams cad du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par rol par 'gro ba dang /
translated: the wheel of Dharma that goes everywhere, the wheel of Dharma that goes to all bodhisattvas, the wheel of Dharma that goes to all maturations, the wheel of Dharma that goes to all times, the wheel of Dharma that goes to all disciples, the wheel of Dharma that goes to all the displays of all buddhas,

original: 'gro pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par chud par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro pa ma lus pa thams cad kyi dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par chud par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa ste /
translated: and the wheel of Dharma that goes to the satisfaction of the faith of all beings without exception.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth deed of the lord buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe lord buddhas turn the irreversible wheel of Dharma in an irreversible manner.

original: 'jig rten thams cad mngon par shes par byed pa'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / ma lus pa thams cad du ma lus par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing mi 'jigs pa'i seng ge'i sgra chen po'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mdzod dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad mngon par shes par byed pa'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / ma lus pa thams cad du ma lus par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing mi 'jigs pa'i seng ge'i sgra chen po'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mdzod dang /
translated: the wheel of the way of manifesting higher knowledge in all worlds, the wheel of the way of the great fearless lion‚Äôs roar of complete buddhahood in all places without exception, the wheel of the way of the treasury of the wisdom of all phenomena and the treasury of the Dharma free of darkness,

original: mun pa med pa'i chos kyi mdzod kyi sgo snang ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / nam mkha'i ngos ltar chags pa @278b med pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgribs pa med pa la so sor rtog pa'i tshul gyi 'khor lo dang /
analyzed: mun pa med pa'i chos kyi mdzod kyi sgo snang ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / nam mkha'i ngos ltar chags pa @278b med pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgribs pa med pa la so sor rtog pa'i tshul gyi 'khor lo dang /
translated: the wheel of the way of the light of the door of the treasury of the Dharma, the wheel of the way of immeasurable wisdom free of attachment like the surface of the sky, the wheel of the way of discerning the obscured nature of the naturelessness of all phenomena,

original: sems can thams cad kyi chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi sgron ma'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos snang bar byed pa'i dus gsum du 'jig rten thams cad la khyab pa'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi sgron ma'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos snang bar byed pa'i dus gsum du 'jig rten thams cad la khyab pa'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang /
translated: the wheel of the pure Dharma eye of all sentient beings, the wheel of the lamp of all worlds, the wheel of the light of the Dharma of omniscience that pervades all worlds in the three times,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gcig tu snyug pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos dang mi 'gal ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / de la sogs pa grangs med pa rnams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gcig tu snyug pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos dang mi 'gal ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo dang / de la sogs pa grangs med pa rnams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: the wheel of the unity of all buddhas that does not contradict the Dharma of all buddhas, and so on. He turned the wheel of the Dharma in countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of ways.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod par 'gro ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod par 'gro ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: He turned the wheel of the Dharma that goes with the conduct of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: In this way, through turning the wheel of the Dharma, the blessed buddhas perform inconceivable buddha activities.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth deed of the buddhas.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /üîΩmi'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lha'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / klu'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po'i pho brang dang / dri za'i @279a *//
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de / mi'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lha'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / klu'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po'i pho brang dang / dri za'i @279a *//
translated: ‚ÄúThe buddhas, the blessed ones, perform the deeds of the buddhas for the sake of sentient beings by entering villages, towns, cities, and royal palaces.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lha ma yin gyi rgyal po'i pho brang dang / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i pho brang dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lto 'phye chen po'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / 'bar ba'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lha ma yin gyi rgyal po'i pho brang dang / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i pho brang dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lto 'phye chen po'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang / 'bar ba'i rgyal po'i pho brang dang /
translated: They enter the palaces of human kings, the palaces of the kings of the gods, the palaces of the kings of the nƒÅgas, the palaces of the kings of the yak·π£as, the palaces of the kings of the gandharvas, the palaces of the kings of the asuras, the palaces of the kings of the garu·∏ças, the palaces of the kings of the kinnaras, the palaces of the kings of the mahoragas, and the palaces of the kings of the pretas.

original: sha za'i rgyal po'i pho brang de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jug pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: sha za'i rgyal po'i pho brang de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jug pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: The Buddha BhagavƒÅn, by entering those palaces of the rƒÅk·π£asa kings, performed the deeds of a buddha.

original: gang 'di grong khyer gyi sgor gshegs nas sa g-yo zhing 'od zer gyi snang bas long ba rnams ni so sor mig thob /
analyzed: gang 'di grong khyer gyi sgor gshegs nas sa g-yo zhing 'od zer gyi snang bas long ba rnams ni so sor mig thob /
translated: Having gone to the city gate, the earth shook and the light shone, so that the blind each obtained sight.

original: 'on pa rnams ni so sor sgra thos /
analyzed: 'on pa rnams ni so sor sgra thos /
translated: The deaf each obtained hearing.

original: smyon pa rnams ni so sor dran pa rnyed /
analyzed: smyon pa rnams ni so sor dran pa rnyed /
translated: The insane each regained their memory.

original: gcer bu rnams kyang so sor gos rnyed /
analyzed: gcer bu rnams kyang so sor gos rnyed /
translated: The naked each found clothing.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni so sor bde ba thob /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni so sor bde ba thob /
translated: The miserable each obtained happiness.

original: sil snyan dang / brdung ba rnams ma brdungs par yid du 'ong ba'i sgra skad 'byin pa dang / brdung ba ma brdungs pa dang / 'phyang 'phrul rnams 'phyang ba dang / brdungs pa'i sgra dang / bram ze sna tshogs mang po rnams kyi sgra skad yid du 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: sil snyan dang / brdung ba rnams ma brdungs par yid du 'ong ba'i sgra skad 'byin pa dang / brdung ba ma brdungs pa dang / 'phyang 'phrul rnams 'phyang ba dang / brdungs pa'i sgra dang / bram ze sna tshogs mang po rnams kyi sgra skad yid du 'ong ba dang /
translated: Musical instruments and percussion instruments emitted pleasing sounds without being played, and those that were played emitted even more pleasing sounds.

original: lta bas mi ngoms shing mi mthun pa med pa gzugs kyi sku ston pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang; mtshan dang / dpe byad bstan pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: lta bas mi ngoms shing mi mthun pa med pa gzugs kyi sku ston pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang; mtshan dang / dpe byad bstan pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: The Blessed Buddha performs the activities of a buddha for sentient beings by displaying the form body, which is never satiated by being looked at and is without anything unpleasant.üîΩThe Blessed Buddha performs the activities of a buddha for sentient beings by displaying the major and minor marks,

original: kun tu gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / brkyad @279b ba dang / bskum pas kyang sems can la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / byon pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / 'chag pa dang /
analyzed: kun tu gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / brkyad @279b ba dang / bskum pas kyang sems can la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / byon pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / 'chag pa dang /
translated: by looking around, by looking in all directions, by stretching, by yawning, by manifesting his supernormal knowledge, by coming, by rising, by walking,

original: bzhugs pa dang / gzims pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / chos 'chad pa dang / cang mi gsung bas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: bzhugs pa dang / gzims pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / chos 'chad pa dang / cang mi gsung bas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddha performs the deeds of a buddha for sentient beings by walking, standing, sitting, and lying down; by teaching the Dharma and by remaining silent;

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / ston pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sna tshogs kyi sems can gyi bsam pa rgya mtsho ma lus pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / ston pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang / sna tshogs kyi sems can gyi bsam pa rgya mtsho ma lus pa dang /
translated: by performing the miracles of magical transformation, instruction, and revelation; and by means of the ocean of the various thoughts of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa grangs med pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang /

translated: In this way, the blessed buddhas engage in the activities of the buddhas in an infinite, inconceivable, and inexpressible number of hundreds of thousands of millions of ways.

original: kyi bsam pa'i stobs ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: kyi bsam pa'i stobs ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba las mi 'da' ste /
translated: In all the worlds, they never fail to tame beings in accordance with their mental capacities.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad la 'jig rten thams cad 'dzud de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad la 'jig rten thams cad 'dzud de /
translated: In this way, they bring all worlds into the activities of the buddhas.üîΩThey never turn away from their objects, they never abandon their great compassion, they never tire of their previous aspirations, and they never cease to contemplate all beings with the power of the wisdom of the activities of the buddhas.

original: yul las phyir mi ldog cing thugs rje chen po gtong ba dang / sngon gyi smon lam la mi skyo ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'gro ba thams cad la rtog pa dang; sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la gnas shing dge ba rgyas pa tshad med pa brnyes te /
analyzed: yul las phyir mi ldog cing thugs rje chen po gtong ba dang / sngon gyi smon lam la mi skyo ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'gro ba thams cad la rtog pa dang; sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la gnas shing dge ba rgyas pa tshad med pa brnyes te /
translated: They abide in the mental activity of all beings and attain immeasurable virtuous expansion.

translated: This is the seventh deed of the blessed buddhas.

original: sku'i spyod pa bltar med pa la bzhugs pa rgyun mi gcod pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kun gyi mdzad pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / dang ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul zhing gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: sku'i spyod pa bltar med pa la bzhugs pa rgyun mi gcod pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kun gyi mdzad pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / dang ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul zhing gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i ye shes dang /

analyzed: spyod pa'i rim pa'i mthu dang / 'jig rten gyi yul dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / 'jig rten gyi yul gyi mthu dang / yul ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mthus kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: the power of the stages of conduct, the power of the worldly realm and the realm of the buddhas, the power of the realm of the buddhas and the worldly realm, the power of the realm that is not a realm, and the power of the realm of the buddhas.

original: mtshan mo dang / nyin par dang / zla ba phyed dang; lo gcig dang / bgrang bar gnas na bzhugs pa nas brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par gnas na bzhugs pa'i bar gyis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: mtshan mo dang / nyin par dang / zla ba phyed dang; lo gcig dang / bgrang bar gnas na bzhugs pa nas brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par gnas na bzhugs pa'i bar gyis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: They remain for a night, a day, a fortnight, a month, a year, a hundred years, a thousand years, a hundred thousand years, an eon, a hundred eons, a thousand eons, a hundred thousand eons, an inexpressible number of eons, up to remaining for an inexpressibly inexpressible number of eons, and in that way the lord buddhas perform buddha activities for beings.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa brgyad pa'o /

translated: They are like a house,üîΩThey purify roots of virtue,üîΩThey cause the minds of all beings to enter and accomplish faith and interest,

original: byas pa'i dgos pa'i mtha' bsdus pa dang / ngo bo ma tshang pa med pas chos la 'jug pa snang par byas pa dang / rtsa ba bcad pa la srid pa'i mig snang bar byed pa dang / sems can rnams la skyo ba ston pa dang /
analyzed: byas pa'i dgos pa'i mtha' bsdus pa dang / ngo bo ma tshang pa med pas chos la 'jug pa snang par byas pa dang / rtsa ba bcad pa la srid pa'i mig snang bar byed pa dang / sems can rnams la skyo ba ston pa dang /

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbang po'i chos kyis mi gnyis par gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbang po'i chos kyis mi gnyis par gshegs pa'o //
translated: This is the nondual Dharma of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, the Dharma that is not dual.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the conquerors,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @285b chos thams cad la nan tan gyis gnas pa bcu ste /
translated: the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, the tathagatas, are intent on ten things.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings la gnas shing ye shes kyi rjes su sangs rgyas pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji ltar smon lam gyis 'byung ba la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings la gnas shing ye shes kyi rjes su sangs rgyas pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji ltar smon lam gyis 'byung ba la gnas pa dang /
translated: The buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, are intent on the realm of phenomena, intent on the wisdom that follows the buddhas, intent on the great compassion of the buddhas, intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô aspirations come to pass, intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô activities are accomplished, intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô wisdom is unobstructed, intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô wisdom is without attachment, intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô wisdom is without obscurations, intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô wisdom is without confusion, and intent on the way in which the buddhas‚Äô wisdom is without error.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can yongs su mi gtong zhing 'dul ba la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ngo bo med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i chos nyid la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das don med pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can yongs su mi gtong zhing 'dul ba la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ngo bo med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i chos nyid la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das don med pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: the blessed buddhas do not abandon beings and remain in the training; the blessed buddhas remain in the nature of reality that is based on the absence of essence; the blessed buddhas are not without purpose;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skal ba mnyam pa ma yin par gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rtag tu sems mnyam pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa'i dbang po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems chags pa med par spyod pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skal ba mnyam pa ma yin par gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rtag tu sems mnyam pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa'i dbang po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems chags pa med par spyod pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: the thus-gone ones remain in the absence of fortune; the blessed buddhas always remain in an even mind; the blessed buddhas remain in the faculty of the equality of all phenomena; the blessed buddhas remain in the conduct of a mind that is unattached;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la 'jug cing mi 'jigs pa yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la 'jug cing mi 'jigs pa yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: the blessed buddhas remain in the engagement with the equality of all phenomena and in the character of the limit of reality that is fearlessness.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of noble family!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos thams cad kyi nan tan la gnas pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos thams cad kyi nan tan la gnas pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten ways in which the lord buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, abide in the practice of all phenomena.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the conquerors!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis @286a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis @286a *//

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ngag thams cad kyi lam thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'jug pa thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi ngo bo'i ye shes thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang /
translated: the path of all speech,üîΩthe engagement of all worlds,üîΩthe essence of the exalted wisdom of all sentient beings,üîΩthe small, middling, great, and various natures of the roots of virtue of all bodhisattvas,

original: 'bring dang / chen po dang / sna tshogs rnam par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / bsam pa tshad med pa rgyun mi gcod pa'i mtshams kyi skad cig ma'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed ba thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang /

original: chos thams cad rkyen dang 'dus pa tshogs par khong du chud pa thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rigs rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes mthong ba thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbye ba mig 'phrul mkhan gyis rnam par phye ba ltar thams cad mngon @286b par mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rkyen dang 'dus pa tshogs par khong du chud pa thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rigs rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes mthong ba thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbye ba mig 'phrul mkhan gyis rnam par phye ba ltar thams cad mngon @286b par mkhyen pa ste /
translated: the understanding of all phenomena as a collection of conditions and assemblies, the understanding of all the wisdoms that discern the families of all world systems, and the understanding of all the dharmadhƒÅtu as being like the display of a magician.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad ma lus par mngon par mkhyen pa bcu'o //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs chen po dang / stobs dang / stobs tshad med pa dang / stobs kyi bdag nyid che ba dang / bzod par dga' ba'i stobs dang / yongs su mnyams pa'i stobs dang / snying po'i stobs dang / mi phyed pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs chen po dang / stobs dang / stobs tshad med pa dang / stobs kyi bdag nyid che ba dang / bzod par dga' ba'i stobs dang / yongs su mnyams pa'i stobs dang / snying po'i stobs dang / mi phyed pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten qualities are the great power of the blessed buddhas, their power, their immeasurable power, their greatness of power, their power of delighting in patience, their power of impartiality, their power of essence, their indivisible power,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i stobs dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi 'phrogs pa'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal gyi chos bcu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i stobs dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi 'phrogs pa'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal gyi chos bcu ste /

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi sku pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis mi phyed pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyis mi chod cing dug gis mi 'jigs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'tshig pa'i me'i bskal pas mi 'tshig pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi sku pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis mi phyed pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyis mi chod cing dug gis mi 'jigs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'tshig pa'i me'i bskal pas mi 'tshig pa dang /

analyzed: 'khor yug chen po'i ri dang mnyam pa dang / gzhan yang /

analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ba spu'ang mi 'gul /
translated: The Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha does not even move a hair on his body.

original: bag tsha bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bag tsha bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: He is not disturbed.

original: bzhud pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal ba'i spyod lam spang pa'ang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: bzhud pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal ba'i spyod lam spang pa'ang mi mnga' ste /
translated: He does not abandon his conduct of walking, standing, sitting, or lying down.

original: yul gang du de bzhin gshegs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu ji tsam du bzhed pa kun tu de tsam du ma bab bo //
analyzed: yul gang du de bzhin gshegs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu ji tsam du bzhed pa kun tu de tsam du ma bab bo //
translated: Wherever the thus-gone one is, he is always as he wishes.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa la'ang gtses par ma gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa la'ang gtses par ma gyur /
translated: He is not harmed by the praise of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyi sems can la'ang gtses par ma gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi 'khrugs pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyi sems can la'ang gtses par ma gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi 'khrugs pa lta ci smos te /
translated: He is not harmed by the blessings of the buddhas. So what need is there to speak of the thus-gone one‚Äôs body being undisturbed?

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal la gnas pa'i chos dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal la gnas pa'i chos dang po'o //

original: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhed na chos thams cad kyi dbyings mchog ma lus pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dang / @287b ri rab lhun po'i ri dang bcas /

original: kho ra khor yug dang / khor yug chen po'i ri dang bcas /
analyzed: kho ra khor yug dang / khor yug chen po'i ri dang bcas /

original: rgya mtsho'i ri dang / nags stug por bcas pa dang / sems can gnas pa'i gnas sna tshogs dang; 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga gcig tu bcug ste tha ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mtha' bzung na /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i ri dang / nags stug por bcas pa dang / sems can gnas pa'i gnas sna tshogs dang; 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga gcig tu bcug ste tha ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mtha' bzung na /
translated: the ocean mountains, the thick forests, the various abodes of sentient beings, and all the worlds without exception into a single pore of a TathƒÅgata.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi brlabs ma gtogs par sems can gzhan gyis shes par mi nus so //
translated: Except for those who are blessed by the TathƒÅgata, no other sentient being can know this.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams du ma de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi sku'i ba spu'i bu gar bcug nas tha ma'i mtha'i bskal par bzung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams du ma de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi sku'i ba spu'i bu gar bcug nas tha ma'i mtha'i bskal par bzung ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One could place all those many worlds in a single pore of his body and hold them there for an entire eon.

original: bzhengs pa dang / bzhud pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal ba dang / bskal par gshegs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs la skad cig kyang sdug bsngal du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhengs pa dang / bzhud pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal ba dang / bskal par gshegs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs la skad cig kyang sdug bsngal du mi 'gyur /
translated: Whether he stands, walks, sits, or lies down, he could travel for an entire eon without his mind being affected by even a moment of suffering.

original: skyo ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: skyo ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: He would not be weary.

original: stobs dang / mthu yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: stobs dang / mthu yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /

original: spyod lam la rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod lam la rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dzin te /üîΩ'bying ba ma yin /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dzin te / 'bying ba ma yin /
translated: Space holds the entire realm of phenomena and all worlds.

original: zhum pa ma yin /üîΩ'phel ba ma yin /
analyzed: zhum pa ma yin / 'phel ba ma yin /
translated: It is neither sinking nor slack.

original: 'bri ba ma yin /üîΩ'byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'bri ba ma yin / 'byung ba ma yin /
translated: It neither increases nor decreases.

original: skye ba ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba ma yin /
translated: It neither arises nor ceases.

original: rnam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a form.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams pa spu'i bu ga gcig tu 'jig rten gyi @288a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams pa spu'i bu ga gcig tu 'jig rten gyi @288a *//
translated: In the same way, the blessed buddhas can place all the worlds in a single pore of their skin.üîΩ

original: khams ma lus pa thams cad kun 'dzin kyang de'i phyir sdug bsngal tshor ba'i sems skye ba gcig kyang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: khams ma lus pa thams cad kun 'dzin kyang de'i phyir sdug bsngal tshor ba'i sems skye ba gcig kyang mi mnga' ste /
translated: In the same way, the Blessed Buddhas can contain in a single pore of their skin all the worlds without exception, and yet not a single thought of suffering arises in them.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal la gnas pa'i chos gnyis pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gom pa gcig gi spyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal la gnas pa'i chos gnyis pa'o // gzhan yang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gom pa gcig gi spyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dra'o //
translated: This is the second quality of the Blessed Buddhas, who abide in the splendor of the power of the great strength of the Buddhas.üîΩMoreover, the Blessed Buddhas can travel to as many world systems as there are atoms in inexpressibly inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields in a single step.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par gom pas spyod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par gom pas spyod do //
translated: They can travel in this way for as many eons as there are atoms in inexpressibly inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields.

original: du ma'i sems skye zhing 'jug pa de ltar gshegs shing 'jig rten gyi khams rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par gshegs te /üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du sems bskyed pa bzhin du bskal par gshegs shing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun gnas shing tshad med pa dang / khor yug chen po'i ri brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par 'gyur ba dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa 'das shing ba spu'i bu ga gcig 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: du ma'i sems skye zhing 'jug pa de ltar gshegs shing 'jig rten gyi khams rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par gshegs te / 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du sems bskyed pa bzhin du bskal par gshegs shing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun gnas shing tshad med pa dang / khor yug chen po'i ri brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par 'gyur ba dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa 'das shing ba spu'i bu ga gcig 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, they go to as many kalpas as there are atoms in the entire world, and they go to as many buddhafields as there are atoms in all the worlds.üîΩAnd they do this in each pore of their bodies, and they do it for as many kalpas as there are atoms in all the worlds, and they do it in all the worlds, and they do it in all the buddhafields, and they do it in all the pores of the bodies of all the beings in all those buddhafields.

original: ji ltar ba spu'i bu ga gcig pa de @288b ltar sku'i spu'i bu ga thams cad de sems can thams cad ji snyed pa ba spu'i bu gar gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar ba spu'i bu ga gcig pa de @288b ltar sku'i spu'i bu ga thams cad de sems can thams cad ji snyed pa ba spu'i bu gar gyur la /
translated: And they do it for as many kalpas as there are atoms in all the worlds, and they do it in all the worlds, and they do it in all the buddhafields, and they do it in all the pores of the bodies of all the beings in all those buddhafields.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad lci bar gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad lci bar gyur la /
translated: In this way, all sentient beings are heavy.

original: sems can de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sor mo gcig gi rtse mos tha ma'i mtha'i bskal par 'dzin te /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sor mo gcig gi rtse mos tha ma'i mtha'i bskal par 'dzin te /
translated: All those sentient beings are held on the tip of a single finger of the Tathagata for the duration of an ultimate eon.

original: ji ltar sor mo gcig gis dang por 'dzin pa de ltar sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mos 'dzin kyang de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsnyel ba'ang mi mnga'/
analyzed: ji ltar sor mo gcig gis dang por 'dzin pa de ltar sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mos 'dzin kyang de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsnyel ba'ang mi mnga'/
translated: Just as he holds them with one finger, so he holds them with the tips of all his fingers. But for that reason, the body of the Tathagata does not become tired.

original: thugs la skyo bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thugs la skyo bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: His mind does not become weary.

original: sdug bsngal gyi reg pa tshor ro snyam pa'i sems phra rab gcig tsam yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi reg pa tshor ro snyam pa'i sems phra rab gcig tsam yang mi skye'o //
translated: Not even a single subtle thought arises that thinks, 'I feel the contact of suffering.'

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams re rer gshegs shing 'jug pa dang / nam mkha' la gshegs shing 'jug pa dang / rgya mo'i phyogs thams cad du gshegs shing 'jug pa dang / de ltar nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' ma lus pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams re rer gshegs shing 'jug pa dang / nam mkha' la gshegs shing 'jug pa dang / rgya mo'i phyogs thams cad du gshegs shing 'jug pa dang / de ltar nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' ma lus pa thams cad dang /
translated: In this way, he goes and enters into each world system, he goes and enters into space, he goes and enters into all the directions, and in this way, he goes and enters into the entire extent of the realm of space.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar 'jug pa dang / skra'i rtse mo'i mtha'i tshad kyi khams thams cad du 'jug pa dang / skra rtsa re re'i mtha' tshad kyi grangs kyi nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa thams cad yongs su gsal ba'i skra'i rtse mo'i mtha'i tshad kyi nam mkha'i khams su 'jug pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam thog ma'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar 'jug pa dang / skra'i rtse mo'i mtha'i tshad kyi khams thams cad du 'jug pa dang / skra rtsa re re'i mtha' tshad kyi grangs kyi nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa thams cad yongs su gsal ba'i skra'i rtse mo'i mtha'i tshad kyi nam mkha'i khams su 'jug pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam thog ma'i mtha' dang /
translated: They enter the limits of the realm of phenomena and the limits of the tips of the hairs. They enter the limits of the tips of the hairs of all the realms without exception. They enter the limits of the tips of the hairs of the realm of space.

original: tha ma'i mtha'i bskal par zad cing 'das kyi bar du phyogs dang / phyogs na skyil mo krung gcig gis bzhugs shing @289a *//
analyzed: tha ma'i mtha'i bskal par zad cing 'das kyi bar du phyogs dang / phyogs na skyil mo krung gcig gis bzhugs shing @289a *//
translated: With this, the tathƒÅgatas remain in the same cross-legged posture for the entire beginningless and endless eon,

original: yongs su longs spyod de /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod de /
translated: and they enjoy themselves.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal la gnas pa'i chos bzhi pa'o; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po'i stobs kyi dpal la gnas pa'i chos bzhi pa'o; ;gzhan yang /
translated: ‚ÄúThis, bhik·π£us, is the fourth power of the Buddha, the powerful might of the Buddha, a powerful Buddha-dharma upon which the bhagavƒÅn buddhas rely, and with which the tathƒÅgatas possess the power of the buddhas.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sku dang / dbu du mar gyur la /üîΩdbu gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i ljags su gyur pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i dbyangs
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sku dang / dbu du mar gyur la / dbu gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i ljags su gyur pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i dbyangs
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha has a body equal to the smallest particles in buddhafields inexpressible times inexpressible.üîΩHe has many heads, and on each head he has tongues equal to the smallest particles in buddhafields inexpressible times inexpressible.

original: kyi yan lag dang / sgra dang / gsung 'jug ste /
analyzed: kyi yan lag dang / sgra dang / gsung 'jug ste /
translated: On those tongues he has voices, tones and speech equal to the smallest particles in buddhafields inexpressible times inexpressible.

original: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sems can gyi khams la go bar byed pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra dang / gsung re res kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i mdo sde dam pa rab tu bshad la /üîΩmdo sde re re la'ang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i chos ston pa'i rjes su 'brang la chos bstan pa re re la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sems can gyi khams la go bar byed pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra dang / gsung re res kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i mdo sde dam pa rab tu bshad la / mdo sde re re la'ang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i chos ston pa'i rjes su 'brang la chos bstan pa re re la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med
translated: They make the entire realm of phenomena understood in the realm of sentient beings.üîΩWith each aspect of their voice, each sound, and each utterance, they teach the sublime s≈´tras as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilƒÅpyƒÅnabhilƒÅpya¬≠parivarta of world systems.

original: pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi tshig dang / 'byed pa rnams kyi brjod pa 'gro ste /
analyzed: pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi tshig dang / 'byed pa rnams kyi brjod pa 'gro ste /
translated: Each s≈´tra contains teachings as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilƒÅpyƒÅnabhilƒÅpya¬≠parivarta of world systems. Each teaching contains Dharma words and explanations as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilƒÅpyƒÅnabhilƒÅpya¬≠parivarta of world systems.

original: ji ltar gang gi phyir chos ston pa de @289b ltar chos thams cad ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar gang gi phyir chos ston pa de @289b ltar chos thams cad ston te /
translated: They teach the Dharma in whatever way is necessary.

original: de dag la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal paüîΩrnams yongs su zad nas /
analyzed: de dag la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal pa rnams yongs su zad nas /
translated: and after those eons equal to the smallest particles in ineffable quintillions of buddha realms have passed,

original: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par ston te /
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par ston te /
translated: they teach for eons equal to the smallest particles in ineffable quintillions of buddha realms.

original: gzhung 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par ston la /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par ston la /
translated: This passage teaches that they teach for eons equal to the smallest particles in all world systems.

original: gzhung 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal pa zad pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa snyed kyi bskal pa zad cing 'das kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab tu phra ba'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal pa zad pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa snyed kyi bskal pa zad cing 'das kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This passage explains that even if eons equal in number to the atoms in all the world systems were to end, and even if eons equal in number to the mental activities of all sentient beings were to end and pass, the emanations of the tathagatas would not come to an end.

original: chos thams cad 'gal me'i 'khor lo ltar 'jug cing chos thams cad shes rab kyi ston te /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gal me'i 'khor lo ltar 'jug cing chos thams cad shes rab kyi ston te /
translated: The tathagatas turn the wheel of the Dharma that is like a firebrand wheel, that teaches all phenomena with wisdom,

original: brda sprod cing the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / chos thams cad snang bar byed pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / chags pa med pa'i mdzod kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / sems can mtha' yas par tshim par byed pa'i 'dul ba'i rgyan gyi chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang /
analyzed: brda sprod cing the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / chos thams cad snang bar byed pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / chags pa med pa'i mdzod kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / sems can mtha' yas par tshim par byed pa'i 'dul ba'i rgyan gyi chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang /
translated: that eliminates all doubts, that illuminates all phenomena, that is the treasury of nonattachment, that is the ornament of the vinaya that satisfies infinite sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus pa'i rgyan @290a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus pa'i rgyan @290a *//
translated: and that is the ornament that summarizes all the bodhisattva deeds.
